title: Learning Editor, Visuals - Reuters
description: Reuters is looking for an accomplished and dynamic journalist to drive training in visual journalism. You will be part of the global learning team, responsible for designing and delivering virtual and in-person training that supports the ambitions of our video and pictures teams and helps us attract and retain the world‚Äôs best, diverse talent.The successful candidate will help to build on our current visuals‚Äô training curriculum, aligning it with our strategic priorities and client needs. They will help to anticipate and identify where we face the most pressing talent challenges, and implement fresh training approaches to address them. They will have a strong track record in video or pictures, be grounded in the news file, and have a flair for engaging and motivating their peers.The Learning Editor, Visuals will think strategically about training formats ‚Äì from workshops, masterclasses and on-demand video tutorials, to online campaigns and on-the-job learning initiatives. They will be confident in organising, facilitating or delivering training across a broad range of topics, including outside of their specific visuals remit.About the RoleAs the Learning Editor, Visuals you will:Work closely with other members of the Global Learning team, the global editors for Video and Pictures, and other senior editors, to design, deliver and coordinate learning programmes.Be digitally fluent and be able to explain audiences' shifting needs.¬†Work with newsroom leaders to help meet visuals‚Äô strategic objectives, on everything from speed, standards and storytelling, to advanced shooting and pictures editing.Be comfortable with technology and be able to support the rollout and adoption of major initiatives like Hive, drones and mirrorless cameras.Proactively help anticipate and identify where our most pressing training needs are within the visuals team, and suggest innovative approaches to address them.Upskill our visuals team to make it fit for the future and give staff the opportunity to develop throughout their careers.Help to drive visuals knowledge across the wider editorial population.Produce relevant learning materials in a range of forms ‚Äì ebriefs, tipsheets, trainer packs, coverage drills, shooting exercises, videos, eLearning modules etc.Deliver interactive and engaging training in real or virtual classrooms.About YouTo be a Learning Editor, Visuals you are likely to have:Extensive experience as a visuals journalist or producerDeep knowledge of our visuals systems and technologyGreat news judgment and facility with story-telling across multiple formatsA strong understanding of our client needsExceptional people and management skills, including an ability to motive staffPlease note, the deadline for applications is Monday, 23rd January 2023.What‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Project Manager - Africa Region
description: Project Manager ‚Äì Africa RegionJoin a team that has unique expertise combining the power of journalism and the law to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights.For more than 35 years, we have promoted the highest standards in journalism by training reporters around the world to cover issues relevant to their local context, accurately and impartially. Today, we work to strengthen local and national journalism, improve media ethics, standards and regulation, combat misinformation, and explore and shape the future of the profession. We do this through newsroom consultancy, journalism training and mentoring, capacity-building, and via our funding of the Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism at the University of Oxford.We provide support to journalists and independent media outlets to produce and distribute high quality journalism in some of the world‚Äôs most challenging environments.We are seeking a Project Manager to join our TRF Programmes Team. The role will be based in South Africa or Kenya.Job descriptionThe Project Manager will help to define the scope and manage a number of projects spread across the African continent. S/he/they will work closely with members of the team to ensure technical and/or business objectives are achieved and the effective delivery of his/her portfolio, including compliance with client and contract requirements. donors.Facilitate information sharing within the Programmes Team and with other Foundation units.Drive the external profile of the Foundation by representing the Foundation in networks, forums, and project consortia.Travel regularly and internationally to monitor programme implementation and ensure programme quality.Identify, assesses and manage risks to the success of the project.Effectively completion of each project to agreed scope and constraints.Prepares and maintains project plans and tracks activities against the plan.Implement effective communication plan and operating rhythm, including provision of regular and accurate reports.Be at the forefront of latest donor trends in key strategic regions across Africa, and share knowledge across the Programmes and Business Development teams.Work closely with the Business Development team to proactively develop a high-quality pipeline for the TRF Africa programme strategy, building key relationships with donors and potential partners.Support the Business Development team on funding opportunities through proposal development, activity design and budget planning.About YouExperience working with a variety of context.Outstanding project or programme management skills, and experience with monitoring and evaluation (building log frames, theories of change).Excellent budget and financial management, including fluency in Excel.Resilience, ability to cope with high pressure projects and work environments and find solutions to problems when they arise.Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlinesAbility to quickly understand complex information and communicate to non-experts.Excellent interpersonal skills ‚Äì able to establish and maintain positive working relationships both management, programme start up, mobilisation and close down.What‚Äôs in it For YouAt the Thomson Reuters Foundation, our people are our greatest assets. title: Editorial Intern

description: The Senior Training Consultant is responsible for training end users, partners and clients as well as developing training and learning curriculum in the use of our 3E products, applications, and processes. objectives and certification examsWork with experts in product development, technical support, sales and marketing to ensure that course content reflects current product featuresAct as a mentor to workflows is highly desiredIntermediate proficiency with Windows based application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, as well as SharePoint)Preferred experience leading training title: Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations in Tax
description: We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations to become a member of our International Tax team in Toronto. This role will be focusing on transfer pricing and valuations. It will be involved in multiple aspects of transfer pricing and valuations for intercompany transactions. This individual will report to the Vice President of Transfer Pricing. The role assumes significant on the job training, and work in a supportive team environment with access to continuous learning and professional growth and development.About the RoleIn this opportunity as a Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations, you will:Assist VP Transfer Pricing with valuations of assets, business and shares, as well as quantitative modeling around transfer pricing.Analyze and research various Transfer Pricing and valuation issues arising from general business operations, restructurings driven by business or other strategic needs. Assist with a variety of projects, including: global intercompany transactions arising from business operations or restructurings, and other general or strategic needs, integration of acquired assets and businesses, ensuring appropriate transfer pricing within parameters of transfer pricing principles and existing company policies,global tax compliance and transfer pricing tax audits globally. Develop a good understanding of various business processes through communications with the business teams, and other corporate groups including Legal, Treasury and Finance.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations if your background includes:A degree in finance or economics. In the alternative, a CBV designation (or CBV student) could be considered.A minimum of 3 years of experience in transfer pricing, economic analysis or valuation. title: Senior Product Manager
description: Thomson Reuters is looking for a highly motivated Senior Product Manager to join the team responsible for driving tax solutions with Thomson Reuters flagship Direct Tax portfolio. In this role, you will work closely with product management and business unit leadership to define product strategy, execution and drive customer satisfaction and growth. You will drive the definition and development of Direct tax solutions for Tax firms, including Big 4, and collaborate to define innovative solutions.This person is a talented, ambitious, self-directed enterprise-software product leader with Corporate Tax expertise to guide products from conception to launch and all stages of the product lifecycle. As a senior leader, you will be responsible for defining and creating valuable new products and features deeply rooted in customer needs to maximize product line profitability. You‚Äôll define the product strategy and vision, work with customers to prioritize unmet user needs, and collaborate with a cross-functional team to launch products to the market.¬†About the RoleIn this opportunity as Senior Product Manager, you will:Driving product solution vision and strategy to support the deployment of ONESOURCE ¬†Income Tax and Tax Provision solutions in global markets for Accounting and Tax firms integrating with ONESOURCE Income Tax, ONESOURCE Corporate Tax and partner products. Enabling revenue generation across sub-segments by ensuring high-quality product features and services are delivered to new and existing geographies and customers.Deliver best-in-class solutions to support corporate tax departments to access and aggregate information from multiple sources, high performance and capable tax provision calculations, integration with tax departments compliance solutions and unparallel visibility to enable tax planning.Capture customer requirements, Conceptualize solutions, conduct market and competitive research, Plan product, and launch activities. ¬†Drive strategic initiatives related to the success of the Tax Provision solution, such as fit within the product portfolio, integration opportunities, product rationalization, and API strategy.Support customer segment channel and marketing organizations through Channel training, Regular and clear communication of product value and developments, and marketing new product features.Own the product definition, design, development, and business success championing tax products to prospects, customers, and internal stakeholders.Apply product management, industry, and market expertise to develop the product roadmap and provide thought leadership on emerging industry trends.Partner with Strategy, Sales, customers, internal stakeholders, Direct Tax and Platform ¬†Product Managers, internal stakeholders, and customers to validate requirements and priorities and refine requirements for the broad market.Work with architecture, technical leads and user experience to determine the right technical solutions to develop faster, better and cost-effective solutions.Manage complete product lifecycle, including market requirements, product release plans, user story and success criteria authoring, and product launch activities.Work with key stakeholders (Product Management, Marketing, Proposition, Support and more) on collateral and campaigns, ensuring a well-planned and executed go-to-market strategy.Collaborate with user experience, product development, operations, service, and support departments and define product design and plans that align with product priorities and meet market demand.Prioritize work and make strategic tradeoff decisions during the development cycle, focusing on delivering immediate business value with shorter release cycles.Monitor market changes and trends to formulate and communicate competitive product positioning and identify opportunities for current and future business consideration.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of Senior and verbal.Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical or business-related field required. CPA¬† or other advanced degree preferred. title: Project Manager, End User Compute
description: EUC Project Manager, End User Compute Portfolio, Employee Technical ServicesDo you enjoy bringing technology strategies from ideas to reality? Do you find purpose in enabling others to perform their best work? Thomson Reuters Employee Experience Technology Team is seeking a Project Manager to be based in our Bangalore or Hyderabad office area to coordinate the delivery of company End User Compute technology initiatives.The End User Compute Project Manager is responsible for assisting in driving global project plans to improve the Thomson Reuters end user experience by introducing new products and services to our Employees and Partners. The Project Manager champions the introduction of new and efficient ways of using physical, virtual and desktop technology services in our day-to-day work environment. The Project Manager will create and drive testing plans, holding all project team members, partners, business testers and associated teams accountable for all assigned work and action items, identifying risks and gaps in use case testing and ensuring remediation, communicating updates and summaries upwards and laterally, engaging with business stakeholders as necessary, and collaborating with external partners to ensure all parties remain synchronized.About the RoleIn this opportunity as Project Manager, End User Compute, you will:Be a Technology Partner for Change Be the face of exciting initiatives to provide our teams with the latest physical and virtual desktop technologies to perform their best work. title: Event Specialist - Brand Marketing
description: The Event Specialist role is a key support function for the Enterprise Sponsorship & Events team. Effectively supporting the Events team by coordinating attendee registration platform, financial, and meeting logistics and processes ensuring all aspects of the events are planned, defined, and executed to the highest of standards. The ability to work as an enterprise, global event team member is essential as the role involves supporting global colleagues to ensure visibility and sharing of best practices.¬†¬†About the role:As event specialist we do:Manage online attendee registration database using the Certain platform; including the website build, managing changes, associated maintenance, reporting, and the Thomson Reuters Event support email inbox.¬†¬†¬†Coordinate all Finance/Accounts Payable requirements; submit all invoices, POs, credit card transactions, and record/report in Smartsheet project management tool¬†Tracking budget for all events and processing event invoice and expense reports in compliance with company policies.¬†Mobile Event App (Spot Me and/or Certain Touchpoint); database management of the project plan and populate content for the mobile event app.¬†Education/Training Session management for SYNERGY Conferences, and database management.¬†Ability to plan and execute events with responsibility for end-to-end delivery and execution with (at times) little to no supervision.¬†¬†Ensure creative execution of meetings/events as directed by the event/program management committees. title: Proposal Coordinator
description: Are you passionate about the chance to bring your proposal development experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?¬† Do you have the skills necessary to schedule, facilitate, and lead bid strategy sessions? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!About the Role: In this opportunity as a Proposal Coordinator, you will be responsible for responsibilities from multiple job roles that are often distinct positions at other companies, including the following:¬†Proposal Coordinator/Process Manager: Managing the RFP response process from the time a solicitation is received through contract award.Proposal Writer:¬†Creating proposal-related materials used in response to formal customer proposal requests.Knowledge Manager:¬†Helping to maintain an electronic repository of content that can be leveraged for future RFPs and inquiries from customers and creating additional proposal tools and resources as necessary.We are looking for an individual with a flexible and organized mind, who can adapt quickly to changing requirements.¬†¬†We want someone who has the focus to stay on task to meet challenging deadlines.¬†¬†We are looking for someone who can be depended upon to work independently and collaboratively with integrity and who is driven to constantly improve themselves and the team.¬†As the Proposal Coordinator, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:Understand requirements of formal solicitations (RFP/RFQ/RFIs) and other procurement vehicles from government entities (primarily federal) and corporations.Coordinate the formal proposal response process, which involves scheduling, facilitating, and leading bid discussions with the RFP response team.¬†¬†Assign action items/deliverables and ensure that all proposal deadlines (internal and external) are met.Investigate previous proposal efforts related to a customer, including performing a comparison of previous RFx documents and proposal responses.Collaborate heavily with key internal business partners (e.g., sales organization, finance, legal counsel) to drive the proposal strategy and create a compelling proposal. Accurately incorporate edits from SMEs, business partners, and reviewers.Communicate with customers regarding procurement-related issues (e.g., clarification requests, proposal revisions, post-award items).Generate complete, accurate, and customer-centric proposal responses (including forms) that comply with solicitation requirements.Coordinate, produce and review final proposal documents for responsiveness to evaluation factors and comprehensiveness.Ensure successful delivery of proposal submission (via email, bid sites, and/or print and ship) by the stated proposal deadline.Build TRSS‚Äô proposal/contract repository with all related project documents (e.g., RFx documents, proposal response documents, award notifications, contract documents).Provide proposal guidance and assistance as needed to internal business partners.Contribute to the ongoing development of best practices and streamlining of processes and tools to effectively manage the ever-increasing volume of workflow.Assist with miscellaneous projects as needed, including the development of additional proposal resources (e.g., templates) to improve efficiency and consistency.Answer questions from customers and internal business partners using the repository to provide consistent and accurate responses.Customize existing repository text for proposal responses as appropriate.About You:This position requires a combination of professional writing experience, project management, technical aptitude, an understanding of Thomson Reuters products, and expert knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Word. title: #2 Operator in Bindery - 1st shift
description: We are hiring an experienced #2 Bindery Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. They are as comfortable advising leaders as they are briefing journalists - working across the business to uncover proactive communication opportunities. title: Implementation Consultant - Global Trade (FTZ)
description: Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are an enterprise software, content and services provider of Global Trade solutions ‚Äì meaning, we build software to help companies manage international trade needs. Our ONESOURCE GTM software helps companies get their products across borders and into the hands of consumers like you. We‚Äôre looking for smart, creative, individuals to work directly with our customers and implement our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) software.As an Implementation Consultant, specializing in our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) module, you will be provided with exciting opportunities to interface with customers & internal teams while supporting global corporations. Through this experience you will gain a greater understanding and appreciation for how corporations are being run in today‚Äôs markets.Within this program we offer extensive training, mentoring, and guidance to start you on the path to a successful career in consulting at Thomson Reuters. You will be trained in best practices, methodologies, and gain the technical and functional skills required to participate in enterprise software projects focused on supporting ¬†Global Trade and Compliance departments. These projects include implementation of enterprise software, content and services to our customers.¬† You will also be exposed to the ONESOURCE platform, and all services provided across our Corporates business.As a member of the Professional Services team, you will strive to enable and simplify the work of professionals in Corporations focusing on Global Trade.The Implementation Consultant will work closely with Project Managers to implement Global Trade software.¬†¬†This position is part of the Corporates Professional Services department.¬† We deliver enterprise Global Trade, Compliance and software that provides critical information and software solutions to companies of all sizes.¬†About YouIn this opportunity as Implementation Consultant - title: Bangladesh Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for a highly motivated self-starting journalist to join the Dhaka bureau as a correspondent who will cover everything from Bangladesh‚Äôs surging needs for energy and commodities, to challenges and opportunities for its massive garments industry, and the plight of the nearly 1 million Rohingya refugees living in the country‚Äôs southeast.As a correspondent in the small but densely populated country of nearly 170 million, the successful candidate will document the expansion of Bangladesh‚Äôs economy which has grown faster than most, but is now under pressure from rising energy prices. Its ties with regional powerhouses China and India will also be of immense interest.About the RoleAs a Bangladesh Correspondent, you will:-- Stay on top of all major news and deliver it to Reuters clients in coordination with the South Asia Breaking News Hub.-- Build contacts across government, industries and regional offices of global humanitarian and other agencies to deliver a rich initiatives file.To be a Bangladesh Correspondent, you should have:¬†-- A passion for news, speed and accuracy.-- Excellent news judgment across the file.¬†-- Very strong writing skills.¬†-- Good communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues outside the country.-- An ability to work calmly under pressure.What‚Äôs in it for You?At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Chief Correspondent, Switzerland & Austria ‚Äì Reuters
description: Chief Correspondent Switzerland & Austria (f/m/d),based in Zurich, Switzerland.We are looking for an ambitious and creative journalist with strong news judgment and a passion for storytelling to lead our reporters in Switzerland and Austria.In this job, you would lead a team of reporters based in Geneva, Zurich and Vienna, reporting in English and German to cover top stories and generate exclusives, ahead-of-the curve analyses and smart multimedia pieces for financial clients, media and dotcom readers. The region‚Äôs file is varied, ranging from the United Nations and the World Health Organisation to Swiss banks and pharma companies to the Vienna-based International Atomic Energy Agency.As Chief Correspondent, you would also build your own source base in the region, develop and pitch story ideas and have an ability to frame stories from the region for an international audience. You would work closely with news editors, the region‚Äôs Breaking News Hub and visuals to hit the top stories hard, and would hire, develop and retain the best and most diverse talent for the team.As our Chief Correspondent for Switzerland & Austria,¬†you will:Ensuring a steady stream of story pitches to enrich the file out of Switzerland and AustriaWorking with correspondents to develop and execute story ideasBuilding and deepening a source base in Switzerland to generate scoops and exclusivesManaging a team of reportersWriting and editing spot copy and trunks and helping to cover breaking newsLiaising with visuals teams to ensure stories are multimediaPlaying a key role in winning top timings by communicating quickly and clearlyTo be¬†Chief Correspondent, Switzerland and Austria,¬†you will likely have:An understanding of how economies workFluent English and strong German and/or FrenchStrong writing and editing skills as well as news judgmentAn ability to work as part of a team across languages and mediaThe ability to work under pressureWhat‚Äôs in it for You¬†At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:¬†An exciting work environment driven by the news¬†A close-knit team that collaborates with Reuters journalists around the world¬†Regular training offers on news subjects, technology and mental health issues¬†¬†Two mental health days per year¬†¬†Hybrid working optionsPlease note, the deadline for applications is Friday 13th January 2023.The successful candidate will report to Sabine Wollrab, co-Bureau Chief, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, BalkansAbout ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news and sports news to professionals via the world's media organizations, desktop terminals, industry events and directly to consumers. For application management function, it interfaces with application teams to ensure processes are in place to support the application, works on application configuration, facilitate creation of monitoring solution. AMS provides incident management by being primary contact for problem notifications, coordination, tracking and reporting. It utilizes diagnostic and debugging tools. It also aids in identifying problem areas within application and utilize post mortem process wherever applicable. AMS provides release management by performing feature and maintenance releases for Client and prod environments, does deployment checkouts, coordinates platform specific patches and upgrades. ¬†This position will provide you opportunities to collaborate with highly skilled peers in developing innovative technical solutions. engagements that evolve the stability, scalability, and supportability of the Cobalt Services environment.Partner with development and other operations team to continue evolving our monitoring and operational procedures for the Cobalt Services architecture.Be a customer advocate ensuring service requests are completed and assigned with the appropriate priority within the operations teams.Update support documentation as needed as environment changes occur.Minimum Qualifications:College degree or technical certification.Minimum of 3 years of experience in an enterprise level operations support description: Business Development Executive - Reuters EventsThis is a full-time position based in London with hybrid working available.Are you looking for a new challenge? Want to work with a range of global brands? Looking to be part of a friendly and inclusive sales team? If so, this might be the role for you! We‚Äôre looking for a Business Development Executive to join the Sponsorship Sales team at Reuters Events, a fast-growing conferencing and events business within Thomson Reuters.Established in 1990 as FCBI, Reuters Events was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.Reuters Events brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in a variety of specialized industry sectors (such as energy, pharmaceutical, automotive, insurance, finance, legal and many more!)¬†to complement our extensive, in-depth content. title: Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters
description: Reader Revenue Analyst - ReutersThis hybrid role will be based from our office in Canary Wharf, London.Do you like using data to tell stories? Are you great at analysing both quantitative and qualitative data? Keen to work as part of an inclusive global team? If so, this role as a Reader Revenue Analyst¬†might be for you.Reuters is seeking a Reader Revenue Analyst to work across a number of business areas within Reuters Professional. Reuters Professional is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world‚Äôs largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news that has a tangible impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and we serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.About the RoleIn this opportunity as Reader Revenue Analyst, you will:Build & interrogate a range of data analytics reports and dashboards for various business units within Reuters.Outline changes and trends in Reuters audience to ensure we're making the right decisions to serve our audience.Develop relationships across teams to gain understanding of organizational needs.Identify opportunities to improve customer products and services based on data.Support the larger team through problem solving and answering ad hoc requests as required.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of Reader Revenue Analyst if you:Are comfortable managing and analyzing large sets of both quantitative and qualitative data sets (including mapping analytics, tracking and performance measurement).Have experience of working with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude, Adobe Analytics)Are comfortable managing advanced Excel spreadsheets and presenting your findings to a range of senior stakeholders across the organization.Have a collaborative mindset, able to work across different departments and liaise with stakeholders based globally.Have an interest in - and an understanding of - mapping user journeys and segmenting audiences (experience of this is desired but by no means prerequisite).Please note: Completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 GMT on Sunday 22nd January 2023. Early applications are actively encouraged.What‚Äôs in it For You?You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:¬∑ COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.¬∑ Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more¬∑ Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing¬∑ Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networking¬∑ Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact¬∑ Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we‚Äôve never talked about with as much pride as we should ‚Äì we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. title: Business Development Manager
description:
This position will provide strategic and operational leadership to all types of field sales roles to aggressively meet sales, revenue, retention and organizational objectives.¬†

description: The Medium Law Firm Senior Sales Executive is responsible for selling Westlaw, Practical Law, HighQ and other products to the legal community within an assigned territory. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Medium Law accounts. Support in developing and executing territory growth strategiesClosing: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and drive deals to closeRelationship Management: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewalsProduct Proposition: Possess core knowledge across products within the sub-segment and engage Sales Specialists where deep product expertise is required to drive to closeReporting: Utilize an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals; title: Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent, Reuters
description: Reuters is looking for breaking news correspondents to cover Ukraine, delivering fast and excellent coverage of one of the world‚Äôs most important stories.This is a role requiring reporters who can spot the most important news inside Ukraine whether it be the latest developments on the frontline of its war with Russia or a sudden change in monetary policy.¬†It will be a fast-paced position filing news alerts on breaking news, writing swift updates and, sometimes, crafting quick sidebars.The correspondents will form a virtual part of our Kyiv bureau - reporting into our Ukraine Chief Correspondent and working closely with the team there ‚Äì but working from our large editorial centre in Gdansk, Poland.About the Role  As Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent you will:Work in a small team watching multiple news sources spanning Telegram channels and government news releases to Ukrainian TV stations and newspapers as well as speaking to Reuters‚Äô reporters in the fieldWrite news alerts, stories and quick sidebar stories on major events in Ukraine and, occasionally, MoldovaBuild relationships with key government departments, the military and companies to ensure Reuters gets the news firstBe part of Reuters‚Äô large editorial centre in Gdansk, which will give you exposure to the company‚Äôs broader global operations and opportunities for secondments elsewhereAbout YouTo be Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent you will have:Fluent English and Ukrainian language skillsAt least two years‚Äô experience covering news in Ukraine or elsewhere in Eastern EuropeA deep understanding of the Ukraine war, as well as Ukrainian politics and economicsAbility to work calmly under pressure and maintain strict discipline on adhering to Reuters editorial standardsExcellent news writing skillsGood communication skills and the ability to work well in a teamPlease note, the deadline for applications is Sunday 8th January, 2023.NB: To be considered for this opportunity please ensure that you submit BOTH a CV and Cover Letter. Your Cover Letter should be addressed to ‚ÄúWhom It May Concern‚Äù and should detail your motivations for applying to the role.What‚Äôs in it For You?At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcare and Multisport cardPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About Reuters Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Editor, Global News Desk
description: Reuters is looking for an ambitious editor/writer for our fast-paced, round-the-clock Global News Desk. Expect to work alongside award-winning journalists in a global news organization long recognized for its commitment to accuracy and fairness. Play a role helping us evolve digitally to stand out from the crowd for everything from business to world events.¬†The role is based in Singapore but consideration will be given to candidates in other Asia locations. The roster includes regular weekend and late shifts.The successful candidate must be an experienced journalist adept at crafting and honing stories¬†that span geographies, industries and markets, from scoops and breaking news to quick-turn analyses and insights. The position demands an understanding of¬†the needs of our wide audience, from financial and professional clients to the world‚Äôs biggest media organizations and digital publishers, and a willingness to help lead us to new readers.¬†You should be ready to experiment with new story formats and tools, working not only as a copy editor but also as a content curator who can pull together a rich package of video, pictures, graphics and text stories. Sharp headlines, ledes and nut grafs are essential. So is spotting gaps in the file and working with news editors to fill them. Experience writing or editing business stories is an advantage.You must have a proven ability to produce clean, engaging stories at speed as you will likely be called upon to take copy from reporters and write or edit major breaking stories. You must be precise with language and able to express complex ideas for specialist and general audiences alike, while enforcing Reuters high standards for accuracy, brevity, clarity, fair comment, impartiality and sourcing.¬†Reuters news is read and seen by more than a billion people every day. We are looking for an editor who can work with our reporters across the globe to produce distinctive journalism in the most compelling formats. Join us and help tell the world‚Äôs most important stories.¬†About the RoleAs Desk Editor you will:Edit breaking news stories at speed for a global audienceCopy edit longer initiative stories for a global audience that may take a few daysEnsure every story is balanced and includes fair commentChoose strong visuals on merit for the stories you editWork the occasional late shifts and weekend dutyCollaborate with colleagues around the worldHelp drive innovation for news production and new ways of telling storiesUnderstand and make effective use of story ‚Äúcodes‚Äù ‚Äì the method we use to direct stories to the right clientsEnsure stories are written to a length that meets the needs of our busy customers¬†About YouYou will likely have:¬†Five or more years of journalism experience as a reporter or production editorFast and accurate writing; superb copy editing skills, including on complex and¬†legally and socially¬†sensitive storiesStrong digital and multimedia expertise and familiarity with the needs of a digital audience; experience¬†optimizing stories for search (SEO) and other platforms, as well as an understanding of analytics¬†are a plusExperience in using and monitoring social media for major storiesAbility to cover topics for multiple audiencesStrong news judgment and ability to shape a story by asking smart questions and challenging premisesCalmness under pressure; ability to make quick and sound decisions in a fast-paced environmentGood communication skills, strong team ethic, diplomacy and collaborationExperience editing newsletters a plusWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. material¬†Work closely across functions, leveraging our internal experts, executives, and customer-facing teams to help identify and create relevant content¬†¬†About YouYou could be a fit for the If you‚Äôre a team player with excellent client and project management abilities, then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!About the RoleIn this opportunity as Delivery Manager, you will:Be responsible for ensuring that contract deliverables are met to the satisfaction of the client and to the high standards of Thomson Reuters Special Services.¬† Provide strong leadership in the execution of complex deals to ensure successful implementation across territories.¬† You‚Äôll provide thought leadership across the Department of Defense territory on how to leverage TRSS solutions to most effectively support TRSS client objectives.Leverage your experience to proactively identify, communicate, and resolve customer issues that threaten the success of the project both internally and at the customer site.Focus on meeting or exceeding established project metrics, identifying risks/potential issues and risk mitigation strategies.Collaborate closely with the Analyst Managers and Technical team to problem-solve optimal solutionsEnsure high-quality delivery of new and existing contracts in the territory. The quarterback for delivery. The centerpoint for the client and the TRSS team. Responsible for the holistic ‚Äúcustomer experience‚Äù.Understand the client‚Äôs mission and how to leverage TRSS solutions to most effectively support their objectivesOwn the management and oversight of day-to-day customer needs and interactions for large and/or complex projects (i.e., client kickoff, regular status meetings, trainings). Large and/or complex projects include, but are not limited to, the following: deals that include services from multiple TR business units, require customized deliverables, have detailed security requirements, and are strategic within the client base.¬† Work with the Client Relationship Manager (CRM) to prepare quality Monthly Status Reports (MSRs) for select projects, capturing major success stories, customer challenges, and future opportunities.Direct and manage pre-sales activities and Proof-of-Concepts (POCs) with prospective clients in close coordination with the analysis and product/technical teams.¬†¬†Serve as extension of Sales, Analysis, and Product/Tech team on the ground; has a strategic view of customer challenges and regularly identifies opportunities to funnel back to the Territory Lead/BDD, Analysis, and Product teams.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of Delivery Manager if your background includes:Have a minimum of 5-10 years of client related experience in the Department of Defense, Federal Law Enforcement, or National Intelligence Community¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† .Are a US Citizen possessing a Top Secret Security clearance (SCI Preferred)Have completed a Bachelor‚Äôs DegreeHave extensive experience with Program/Project management (PMP Cert preferred)Work well with teams and drive disparate groups toward common client goals.Communicate effectively and relate to multiple levels of a client's organization.Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders demonstrating strong interpersonal and communication skills.Are a self-starter, highly motivated, team player with strong business acumen, superior organizational skills and the ability to follow through.Possess Excellent writing and presentation skills.Are proficient in web-based demo platforms, MS Office/internetYou‚Äôll also need to be able totravel to customer locations and company meetings (car and limited airplane travel).carry company materials (to include laptop, marketing material, etc.).Sit for long periods of time in front of a computer.Use the phone.What‚Äôs in it For You?At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Our Culture: You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the communityLearning & Development: You are will be joining a growing sales team that has the commitment of the company to prioritize organic growth and has made investments to expand the sales team capabilityCompensation: Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your successBenefits: Extraordinary benefits packageSocial Impact:¬† Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraisingABOUT THOMSON REUTERS SPECIAL SERVICESTRSS is a wholly US-owned, independent subsidiary of Thomson Reuters. Our analysts combine open-source research with the full suite of proprietary Thomson Reuters data holdings to deliver actionable intelligence to our clients.We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world‚Äôs businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise, and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science, and media markets, powered by the world‚Äôs most trusted news organization.As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. description: We are hiring a Press Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. title: Customer Success Executive, Corporate - Remote
description: Customer Success is not only a function or a team at Thomson Reuters, but also our reason for doing business. We measure our success based on that of the prioritization of our customer needs and goals. The relationship that we create with our customers determines the future benefits for both, the customer, and our company. The ONESOURCE Customer Success Executive (CSE) for Corporate Large Accounts will be responsible for customers within our Indirect Tax. To begin, the CSE will participate in a virtual on-boarding program to learn the respective specialized product lines, as they acquire their book of business. The CSE is assigned a book of business by geographical territory and will be responsible for the development of customers knowledge on their suite of offerings. The CSE will manage these customers to drive performance towards Thomson Reuters' strategic objectives and retention goals. This will require the management of multiple projects and strong business acumen to remove obstacles interfering with growth and retention of customers.Remote based position - can be based anywhere in the US. About the Role:In this opportunity as a Customer Success Executive, you will:Understand ‚Äúwhat success looks like‚Äù for our customers and partner with them to define their business outcomes. Deliver educational activities across the customer lifecycle including onboarding, adoption, and long-term commitment and track against targets over timeTracking customer health ‚Äì Identify, track, and escalate components of our customer health; raise critical customer concerns internally and mobilize resources to resolve issues. Monitor usage data, health gauges and growth opportunities to build useful insights and strategically adjust when neededGrowing value ‚Äì Assess the maturity of deployed offerings and functionality to make recommendations for improvement. Work closely with the commercial team to activate those opportunitiesDrive Customer value: Ensure customers derive maximum value from their investment and collaborate with other Thomson Reuters partner teams that result in retention, growth, and education, tailored to their workflowLeverage Technology: Leverage technology tools (e.g., Gainsight and Salesforce) to keep all client information updated, manage team pipeline, and forecast financial projections accuratelyPresent: Lead business plan presentations of your book of business which account for planning, preparation, and execution of how to maximize efficiency, retention, and growth within your customer baseKey DeliverablesDevelop relationships and optimize enterprise customer accountsDelivery of target financial and customer experience objectives for the Corporates segment (e.g., client renewal rate and value growth through increased customer adoption)Forecast monthly renewal and growth targetsReporting on market and competitor activitiesPresentations across internal meetings with other company functions necessary to perform duties and aid business developmentEnsure key metrics are tracked such as active users, user logon, usage metrics and overall retention ratesLiaise between the customer and Thomson Reuters teams such as, customer support, professional services, technology, and product management teams, as neededAbout You: You're a fit for the role of Customer Success Executive if you have:8+ years of professional experience in Accounting or US Taxation, with a minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in client management4-year college degree required, master‚Äôs degree or equivalent preferredExperience in ONESOURCE‚Ñ¢, Gainsight and Salesforce, a plusFunctional/technical skills in SaaS implementations and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) applications, a plusExperience working in and around cloud software solutions and cloud delivery modelsStrong business acumen and communication skills; title: Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters
description: Reader Revenue Analyst - ReutersThis hybrid role will be based from either our New York or Toronto offices. Applications from other locations will also be considered.Do you like using data to tell stories? Are you great at analyzing both quantitative and qualitative data? Keen to work as part of an inclusive global team? If so, this role as a Reader Revenue Analyst¬†might be for you.Reuters is seeking a Reader Revenue Analyst to work across a number of business areas within Reuters Professional. Reuters Professional is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world‚Äôs largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. title: Latin America Mining Correspondent
description: Reuters is seeking an experienced reporter with a proven track record of breaking news and developing enterprise stories to cover the important and sprawling mining sector in Latin America. The role would involve covering a key mining region that is home to the world‚Äôs top producers of copper and vast reserves of lithium, key metals for electrification, as well as Brazil-based iron ore and nickel giant Vale. The race to secure metals for the energy transition makes Latin America a crucial story where geopolitics, corporate maneuvering and resource nationalism meet.¬†We want someone who can drive our coverage in the region, coordinating with other beat reporters, to ensure we are fast and accurate on key breaking news, as well as spearheading ambitious story ideas to take our coverage deep inside the sector from business strategies to impacts on the environment and indigenous tensions. The successful candidate would be based in Santiago, Chile or Lima, Peru, but would have a mandate for travel to other regional mining hotspots. We are seeking someone with an ability to develop sources, breaking regular exclusive news and who has a flair for writing.The¬†Correspondent¬†should have the attention to detail and speed to cover fast-paced breaking stories ‚Äì and the ability to deliver insightful big-picture stories, explaining complex topics to readers around the world.In the role, you will:Have the writing and reporting ability to deliver deeper stories swiftly and cope with fast-paced breaking newsDevelop sources to break news on mining in Chile, Peru and Brazil as well as building up networks in Bolivia, Argentina, Colombia and beyond.Have the ability to elevate copy from stringers and mentor more junior members of the teamWork closely with visuals colleagues in identifying and delivering strong story packages for reuters.com and media clients¬†The preferred candidate to be our¬†Latin American Mining Correspondent¬†will have:At least 5 years in journalismFluent spoken and written English; and strong to fluent Spanish¬†Portuguese would be a plus, but not mandatoryExperience in covering business and economicsThe enthusiasm, drive and ability to think outside the boxThe skills to produce deeply reported, impactful enterprise journalism that illuminates complex topics¬†The capacity and ambition to help lead a teamWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Sales Executive, Tax & Accounting - Large Firms
description: About the Role¬†The‚ÄØSales Executive‚ÄØin our Tax & Accounting Professionals Large client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 30+ professionals.¬†The Sales Executive‚ÄØposition is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.¬†¬†The successful Sales Executive:‚ÄØ¬†Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.‚ÄØ¬†Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters‚Äô products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.‚ÄØ¬†Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.¬†What You Will Do:¬†In this opportunity as a‚ÄØ Sales Executive, you will:¬†Attain sales quotas on a monthly basis¬†Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer¬†Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration¬†Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations¬†Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner¬†Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Client Executive and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory¬†Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)¬†Attend sales meetings and conventions as required¬†Manage open territories in the event we have them¬†¬†About You:¬†You may be a fit for the role if you have/are:¬†Minimum 3 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment¬†Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus¬†Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques¬†Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations¬†Strong prospecting and closing skills¬†Strong time management and organization skills¬†Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation¬†Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude¬†Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude¬†High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics¬†What‚Äôs in it For You?¬†At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†Hybrid Work Model:‚ÄØCurrently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†Culture:‚ÄØGlobally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more¬†Wellbeing:‚ÄØComprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†Learning & Development:‚ÄØLinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networking‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†Social Impact:‚ÄØEight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact‚ÄØ¬†Purpose Driven Work:‚ÄØWe have a superpower that we‚Äôve never talked about with as much pride as we should ‚Äì we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.‚ÄØ Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.¬†Compensation:‚ÄØBase salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success¬†¬†#LI-D2EDo you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we‚Äôve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world‚Äôs most global news services ‚Äì Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. Accessibility As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position.  The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following states (CA, CO, CT, NV, WA) and/or remote. The target total cash compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $126,000 - $234,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive. Pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual‚Äôs knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay and any target sales incentive are part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

title: Manager, Project Management
description: The Senior Project Manager will define, scope, initiate and manage large company projects of high risk, complexity, and visibility while supporting the business. May manage project management staff. Typical scope of the projects will be greater than 12 months, involve more than 10 FTEs which are cross functional and be a project that is critical to the company meeting its objectives. Team members in a Project Manager role are expected to display core competencies such as Project Delivery, Financial Management, Risk Management, and Estimating and Planning. Expected expertise in each of these areas will vary based on job level.Responsibilities and Duties:Project Management - Actively manage S&R and Customer Markets projects/initiatives.Assigns work, allocates resources, monitors results, controls costs and manages staffDefines project scope and objectivesManage RAID items and high-level timelinesManages the change control procedure gaining agreement for revisions to the project from project stakeholders and ensure full impact of significant changes are understood by project stakeholders.Ensures all parties are aware of project scope and milestones. Highlights divergence from that scope, and adjusts it where necessary to reflect changing circumstances, acts a communication liaison.Ability to create business cases or business analysis to outline problem statement, resolution options and cost/benefit trade-offsCommunicates difficult and complex concepts effectively, by altering communication style to the audienceInfluences others to adopt a point of view for ideas and initiativesDecisions are guided by resource availability, business unit or functional business plans, impacting support and funding of projects, products, services or technologiesImplements processes to produce desired changesIn-depth business and managerial knowledge of a department or sub-functionAbility to identified interdependencies among systems, processes, and people though process analysisInterprets internal and external business issues and recommend solutionsFacilitate discussions around defining business requirementGathers analyses and presents complex concepts or sensitive information for discussion with more senior levels of managementAbility to document business processes and reporting processesDirects the resolution of complex or unusual technical, operational and organizational problems which may be multi-disciplinaryGood knowledge and understanding of related functionsApplies understanding of current industry trends to analyze and review diverse issuesDemonstrates people leadership skillsQualifications:Self-starter ‚Äì able to prioritize actions among multiple teams to drive decisions and progressStrong presentation skill ‚Äì ability to report program status to high level executivesStrong analytical skill ‚Äì ability to investigate and understand requirements from a business perspectiveStrong critical thinking skill ‚Äì ability to ‚Äúconnect the dots‚Äù within complex systems and business processesHave a basic understanding of finance and accounting rulesStrong communication skillConflict resolution ‚Äì ability to manage multiple competing priorities and teams, and adapt and flex with projects as neededAble to build effective relationship among multiple groups inside and outside of Customer MarketsFinancial ManagementPeople LeadershipStakeholder RelationshipsEducation: Bachelor's DegreeDo you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Visuals Journalist, Milan - Reuters
description: Reuters News & Media is looking for a dynamic and talented Visuals Journalist to join our Italy team based in Milan. You will be a talented photojournalist with proven ability to shoot and edit video. We are looking for a team player and a self-starter with plenty of initiative to generate story ideas and inject a creative approach to storytelling. You will have a good understanding of the news agenda in Italy ¬†‚Äì from politics and religion to sport and entertainment, to culture and new business.You will have excellent communication skills, an unflappable temperament, and a passion for newsgathering and visual storytelling. An ability to network and develop relationships with officials and important contacts that will result in access and fair treatment is crucial.The scope of the role ranges from the delivery of the fastest, differentiated images of breaking news and events in the most competitive circumstances, to the creation of structured pictures or multimedia stories, either as an individual or as part of a wider regional or global team.A commitment to preserving the Thomson Reuters Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias is essential.As our trusted Visuals Journalist, you will:React fast to breaking news, including an ability to provide live video coverage, and a willingness to travel on assignments, sometimes at short noticeBe proactive in identifying, pitching and producing in-depth stories around the news, through pictures and video, with an awareness of trends in and requirements of digital audiencesProduce top quality coverage in Italy, working in close collaboration with Reuters photo and video staff as well as editors on the Global Pictures Desk, to contribute highly competitive pictures and video to the Reuters News wire for global subscribersBe responsible for coverage of planned events, sports and news, ¬†and maintain and update the client-facing news diaryCoordinate assignments with multimedia teamsEnsure safety newsgathering protocols are followedTo be our Visuals Journalist, you will likely have:A proven track record of winning the big storiesExcellent photojournalism and editing skills proven by at last 5 years work experience as a full-time photojournalistExperience in sports photographyA sharp eye for visual elements that are needed to make a good pictures and video storyBasic knowledge of shooting and editing video materialAn understanding of wire service clients and market needs both domestically and internationallyExcellent news judgment as well as a good knowledge of Italian politics and governmentThe ability to tell stories through multimedia, producing picture/video packages and picture stories as well as capturing individual defining momentsA thorough understanding of the latest digital visual technologies for photographing, filming, editing, transmitting, and sharingA unique "eye" able to compose interesting pictures on the fly and produce a well-rounded report of pictures during fast changing news eventsExperience and ability to compete at the highest level working under high pressure against tight deadlines, transmitting photos on the run via wifi, cellular modems and satellite phonesStrong communication skills and the ability to work well in team environmentsAbility to write clear, error-free captions and video scriptsBasic experience with flying drones is also preferred (but not essential)Italian language skills are preferred (but not essential)NB: To be considered for this opportunity please ensure that you submit BOTH a CV and Cover Letter. Your Cover Letter should be addressed to ‚ÄúWhom It May Concern‚Äù and should detail your motivations for applying to the role.¬†¬†Please note, the deadline for applications is Friday 13th January 2023.What‚Äôs in it For You?At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcarePerks: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news and sports news to professionals via the world's media organizations, desktop terminals, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Sports Correspondent
description: Reuters is seeking a Correspondent for its Bangalore Sports Desk.The sports team in Bangalore is an integral part of the global Reuters sports file and delivers breaking news across geographies with the accuracy, speed, context and freedom from bias our clients expect.The ideal candidate is an excellent storyteller, writer and reporter with sound news judgment and the ability to multi-task. A familiarity with North American sports and prior editing experience are advantages, though not prerequisites.You should be someone who is comfortable working in a diverse team and flitting between sporting disciplines. You could be asked to write stories on anything from soccer and golf to basketball and the Olympics on a given day. The team is often the first point of contact for breaking sports news, so a calm head, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with colleagues who are spread across the world are all essential.Responsibilities:Monitoring of U.S. and other global sports events, news sources, websites and media outletsReporting and writing stories for the Reuters global newswireYou will report across the sports file and should be a strong writer with a broad interest in sports and a passion for delivering news fast. The ability to write lucid, engaging copy is essentialYou will work daily with colleagues in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Africa to write and report out stories and set the news agenda each dayYou will also be expected to jump fast on hints of breaking news and build a file of initiative storiesThe Sports team in Bangalore runs seven days a week. Team members are entitled to two days off per week and the job will often involve late nights and/or early startsThe willingness to work across different shifts is vital. Shifts can change at short notice for extended periods to focus coverage on sporting events around the globeIf you are interested, please email a copy of your r√©sum√© and a brief covering letter to hiring manager Simon Jennings before Feb. 28.Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Order Management Specialist
description: Responsible for the implementation of the entire order to billing process and for providing ongoing order management support for sales and clients.Aligned to a designated client base and is accountable for building relationships with internal and external customers, playing a key role in improving service results.Confirms all client orders are correct for sales and financial reporting billing/credits/cancellations for new and renewal orders.Obtain information required to process orders (user data, product reference details, installation details, exchange requests, billing dates, sales codes, billing account contacts).Ensure appropriate technical and commercial approvals are in place.Provide research and support for billing disputes, ensuring issues are resolved according to Compliance issues.Process order adjustments, applying appropriate commercial policies and guidelines.Establish key client and sales relationships in order to facilitate improved administration and customer satisfaction.Assist in annual renewals processing, including analyzing pricing, reviewing amendments and invoicing.Manage and resolve external & internal queries relating to quote/order testing and regression testing.Spot trends and make recommendations for enhancing systems and procedures.May review Free Trial expiration notices with account teams.Experience : 3+ yearsShift timing : title: Multimedia News Producer
description: DESCRIPTION:We are looking for a multimedia journalist to join the 24X7 digital operations of Reuters, which operates one of world's largest and most credible news websites and an online business serving a variety of digital clients worldwide. The successful candidate must have clear-sighted news judgment to arrange, select and package from the hundreds of news stories hitting the wires every hour. The multimedia news producer will work closely with Reuters' main editorial services in deciding what the top stories will be on every topic from politics and policy, business, markets, sport, entertainment and lifestyle. At Thomson Reuters, we deliver intelligent information quickly and efficiently, so professionals have knowledge to act. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the financial, legal, tax and accounting, scientific, healthcare, and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization.¬†Location: BangaloreKEY RESPONSIBILITIES:The multimedia news producer will be part of the tight-knit team manning the Global Online desk in Bangalore, sub-editing/localising and filing stories with relevant pictures for the Reuters Online Reports (OLR) and the¬†revamped¬†reuters.com¬†website. The producer should have a keen eye for detail and keep our target sophisticated news consumer business audience in mind while ensuring the website is updated with the latest and best stories, photos, slideshows and videos curated from the Reuters wires, photo and video service.¬†QUALIFICATIONS:Degree in Journalism/Mass Communication from a reputed university/institute.REQUIRED SKILLS:At least three-year experience in a news agency, newspaper or TV newsroomImpeccable writingStrong news judgementKnowledge of economy, policy, markets, technology, sports and entertainmentMultimedia experienceDESIRED SKILLSHigh level of creativity, providing excellent packaging ideas for the web and thinking beyond the obvious ¬†Strong team player, good communication skillsFast and accurate editing and packaging for the webGood at using editorial technologySolid understanding of legal risks and strong ethics¬†APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:Send a cover letter explaining why you believe you are qualified for this positionInclude a CV¬†The Global Online Desk in Bangalore is a 24X7 operation and the team members work on 8-hr shifts that go round the clock. title: #3 Operator in Subscription Services - 1st shift
description: We are hiring a Subscription Services Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a #3 Subscription Services Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota.
