title: U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist)
description: Reuters is seeking a focused, driven journalist with a passion for breaking news to join our U.S. team covering the global energy supply crisis, the impact of sanctions on Russia on global crude and fuel markets as well as the United States‚Äô role as the world‚Äôs top consumer of oil and one of its biggest producers. This is a position for a reporter who can move effortlessly from covering physical cash and futures energy markets and industry spot news, to long-term enterprise stories on international energy flows, trading strategies, boardroom upheaval and investment trends across the sector.Energy policy is evolving rapidly as many countries move toward cleaner fuels and as governments seek to contain the political impact of high oil prices and tight fuel supplies on inflation and consumer spending. The successful candidate will need to play their part in ensuring Reuters wins the biggest stories impacting the trade flows of the world‚Äôs most traded commodity. You will deliver breaking news on oil production, consumption, transportation, storage, exports and imports.We need a reporter who can produce enterprising scoops, shed light on the opaque energy market, and develop deep sourcing in a secretive industry. The candidate should have strong team skills and be keen to turn their hand across the entire range of commodities coverage as part of a strong, competitive reporting squad that has a hard-won reputation for producing agenda-setting coverage for both our core energy and commodity market users, as well as for our media, investor and financial professional audience. Our regional energy correspondents are based in New York, Houston, Canada and Latin America so the ability to work in a virtual team is essential.About the RoleAs our U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist), you will:Provide top-quality coverage of physical and future oil markets and break the most important news in those marketsBring original ideas for initiative storiesBe a strong all-round journalist comfortable breaking news and filing at speed as well as working on long-form piecesWork closely with the global oil markets teamBe based in New York or HoustonAbout YouTo be our U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist), you will ideally have:At least two years of experience covering energy, preferably with experience in physical crude or fuel market coverageA proven ability to break newsA track record developing deep sources, and reporting and writing both long- and short-form storiesStrong news judgment, ability to write with speed, clarity and accuracyThe ability to clearly explain complex industry subjects to a wide audience as well as to a financially sophisticated readerProven ability to work closely and collaboratively as part of a diverse, driven team spanning multiple regions. Reporters preferring to strike out alone need not apply for this positionWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefitsPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.(Internal candidates: Please note this position is incorrectly listed as being in the EIC job family).About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Manager, IAM

within our Identity and Access Management team.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†In this role, which will focus on identity governance and identity data management, you will collaborate with technology peers and business title: Editor-in-Charge, U.S. Energy Markets
description: Reuters is seeking an experienced journalist to drive coverage of energy markets in the United States, the world‚Äôs top oil consumer and one of the biggest producers. This is an exciting time to take the helm in one of the most important regions for global oil coverage on a team with a hard-earned reputation as the go-to news service for the sector. The global energy supply crisis has hit the pockets of U.S. consumers in the world‚Äôs largest economy and caused political damage to the administration of President Joe Biden. The country is an important exporter of crude and fuel and also a big importer. Domestic supplies are tighter than they have been for a generation and the global industry is in tumult as it deals with the fallout from war in Ukraine and the accelerating energy transition. This is an opportunity for an experienced journalist to show their strength as a lead writer setting the agenda for coverage and producing stories that cater to the needs of both screen clients and a wider audience hungry to read about the broad implications of the news we break. The successful candidate would be comfortable leading reporters on the nuts and bolts of cash market price discovery as well as on breaking the biggest stories that impact those markets. You should be as adept at publishing market moving headlines as writing investigative stories, in-depth analysis and exploring new ways to deliver high-value, specialized content to our clients. The U.S. Energy Markets Editor needs to be hands-on in framing, pitching and editing a range of stories from reporters in a specialist team in New York and Houston as well as a wider group of reporters across the Americas. ¬†The successful candidate will have a proven track record driving and publishing breaking news, writing and editing the biggest news stories in the sector, and managing a team of journalists. Exceptional candidates without management experience but a clear idea of how they would grow into the role are also encouraged to apply. About YouAs our U.S. Energy Markets Editor, you will:Set the agenda for U.S. energy markets coverage for the regional team, in line with global editorial goalsDrive a team of experienced correspondents to report and write first-class cash market and futures market reports, to break exclusive news and publish the most insightful stories on the markets and industries they coverEnsure depth and quality in everything we publish: from market reports through to investigative workEdit to the highest level before sending stories to the publishing deskSpearhead initiatives to develop the best sources across the industry to ensure we maintain our position as a leading provider of energy news Adapt quickly to changes in markets and policy to ensure we deliver outstanding coverage on the most important regional energy storiesDrive development and career progression across the team¬†About the RoleTo be our U.S. Energy Markets Editor you will likely have:At least five years of experience editing and reporting on a real-time financial news fileAt least two years of experience managing a team of journalistsAt least two years of experience reporting on physical oil or commodity marketsA proven track record of framing, pitching and editing both breaking news and initiative stories, identifying trends and delivering agenda-setting big-picture stories ahead of the competitionWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefitsPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important storiesHybrid Work Model:¬†Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.Culture:¬†Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and moreWellbeing:¬†Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeingAbout ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Fresno, CA)
description: Sales Executive Job Description: Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? title: Canada Economics Reporter

Based in Ottawa, the successful candidate will be a detail-focused journalist able to move deftly from coverage of the central bank and finance department to economic indicators. The role requires an ability to execute original initiative stories on the Canadian economy at a time when the central bank is battling persistent inflation and the economy facing a potential recession. title: Business Development Manager - Reuters Events
description: Business Development Manager - Reuters Events - LondonThis full-time role will be based in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.Are you a collaborator? Someone who can get the best out of their team whilst delivering sales targets? Looking to take your sales career to the next level? If so, this might be the role for you! Reuters Events are seeking a new Business Development Manager to generate both new and existing business opportunities with some of the world's leading brands in the Downstream and Petrochemicals markets.Established in 1990 as FCBI, Reuters Events was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.Reuters Events brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with our domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in highly specialized industry sectors. We deliver knowledge and foster relationships that shape business strategies and safeguard success at leading companies across the globe.About the RoleAs our Business Development Manager, you will:Lead the sale of sponsorship opportunities within Reuters Events‚Äô flagship downstream and petrochemical conference portfolios.Sell multi-product, tailored to a range of clients in the downstream industry as part of our year-round activations (knowledge of the downstream energy industry a plus, but by no means mandatory!).Identify, profile and engage both new and existing clients in the energy sector.Develop and maintain long-term relationships with a network of internal and external C-suite stakeholders.Share your expertise by leading a small team of two salespeople to success and managing future sales strategies.The PersonTo be our Business Development Manager, you will likely have: Demonstrable experience of selling in a B2B environment (it doesn't have to be conferences!).The desire to keep learning, with a can-do attitude.An understanding of tele-sales etiquette, with demonstrable experience of generating new business opportunities.The ability to motivate others as part of a collaborative and inclusive sales team and spot new opportunities for growth.A team-orientated mindset. We're team players at Reuters Events and are looking for someone that shares our collaborative ethos. We reward individual performance and celebrate our successes as a team. title: Senior Insights Analyst
description: Job Description: Are you passionate about data and believe that analytics should be a key input to shaping the future of a company? Do numbers speak to you, and do you like to dig for trends and patterns in whatever you observe? Then write to us. The Data & Insights team at Reuters, the world‚Äôs largest News Agency, is looking for a Senior Insights Analyst that is energetic and focused.¬†They should be willing to boldly explore data, question assumptions while being an excellent team player.¬† Candidates should possess excellent statistical training, be skilled at applying statistics to business problems and communicate clearly. Their work will inform the editorial team on news coverage, product team on customer insights and the sales team on opportunities. Candidates interested in finance/business and familiar with Media business preferred but it is NOT a requirement, especially if you can demonstrate willingness and capacity to learn.¬†About the Role & Responsibilities:As our Senior Insights Analyst, you:¬†Will take ownership of exploring and analyzing large volumes of data¬†to present data-driven insights to internal stakeholders including senior managementHelp analyze news output to guide Reuters newsroom on news coverage and efficient deployment of resourcesHelp editorial and business leaders track content commitments to various client segments Help formulate and track KPIs and OKRs and present them in a easy-to-read format to internal stakeholdersProvide new and original ideas on types of analyses that can be carried out on a given data set¬†with an eye toward providing predictive and actionable insights to stakeholdersLead customer behavior data review and analyses and extract actionable insights that help improve product and editorial offeringsTake ownership of specific tasks and be responsible for maintaining and enhancing the output of such tasksBe efficient at analyzing new requirements, build processes and deliver timely solutions¬†Help team conduct quality checks of the data to ensure its accuracy¬†and help the team with keeping documentation on processes and workflowsAs our Senior Insights Analyst, you:¬†Should be a self-starter with a curiosity to explore large volumes of data¬†and work with teams across the organizationShould have worked in a role where they have carried out data analysis in any field including (but not limited to) web analytics, customer analysis and product performance metrics¬†Possess knowledge of various statistical methods and tools to analyze the data ‚Äì experience or schooling in Python, Machine Learning, Predictive Analysis strongly preferred¬†Ability to conceptualize and build interactive dashboards to represent data¬†Be able to provide new ideas on types of analyses that can be carried out on a given data set¬†Be capable of providing concise and actionable insights that can be presented to senior management¬†Is energetic, willing to learn, capable to keeping open lines of communication and eager to work in a team¬†Have a keen eye to spot data irregularities and perform ongoing data sanity checksFlexible and able to meet the changing demands of the business priorities¬†Sound knowledge of news and current affairs. Knowledge of financial news would be an added advantage¬†Required QualificationsTo be our Senior Insights Analyst, you will likely have:Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Engineering or any related technical field¬†Minimum 5 years of proven experience in data analysis, building dashboards and extracting actionable insights for senior managementComfortable writing SQL queries and experience in working with AWSExperience in Tableau/Qlik View/Power BIIntermediate/Advanced MS Excel skills (pivots, charts, functions etc.) and PowerPoint¬†Familiarity working with data wrangling tools such as AlteryxPreferred Qualifications:¬†Experience/Knowledge in Big Data or Data Warehousing tools¬†Experience working on Regression, Classification, Text mining, Text Classification, Forecasting, and Clustering¬†Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Conferencing and Events Manager - Reuters Events
description: Conferencing and Events Manager - Reuters EventsThis full-time position will be based in our office in London with hybrid working available.Are you highly organized? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same? Keen to share the success of our global portfolio of events?¬†If so, this might just be the role for you.We're looking for an ambitious, highly organized and collaborative Conference and Events Manager to join Reuters Events. As part of this role, you'll be based in London (working on a hybrid basis) and will play a key role in ensuring that our busy portfolio of physical and virtual events are planned and delivered effectively across a range of global locations.Established in 1990 as FCBI, Reuters Events was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe, and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.Reuters Events brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in highly specialized industry sectors to complement our extensive, in-depth content. Reuters Events exists to deliver the intelligence and foster the relationships that shape strategy and safeguard success at leading companies worldwide.About the RoleAs an Conference and Events Manager you will:Plan and project manage the end-to-end logistics for a collection of B2B conferences and events.Source the best venues and external suppliers for our conference's needs, ensuring that we're delivering great experiences to our delegates whilst keeping a close eye on budgets.Work closely with our production, sales and marketing teams to ensure that we're covering all bases in the setup and delivery of our industry-leading events.Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to bring the events to life and ensure their commercial success.Work closely with our Event Coordinators and deploy their skillsets where necessary.About YouTo be our Conference and Events Manager you will likely have:Demonstrable experience of project managing B2B conferences, events or exhibitions.A collaborative attitude, with the ability to develop relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.Great communication skills (written and interpersonal), with the ability to liaise with a range of senior stakeholders.Experience of sourcing venues (desirable, but by no means pre-requisite!)A keen eye for detail and the desire to deliver the best events possible.Please note, the deadline for applications is 23:59 (GMT) on Sunday 15th January 2023. Early applications are strongencouraged.What‚Äôs in it For You?You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and moreWellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeingLearning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networkingSocial Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impactPurpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we‚Äôve never talked about with as much pride as we should ‚Äì we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the worldAbout Reuters¬†Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. title: Markets Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for an experienced, ambitious journalist to help drive coverage of financial markets from Japan, the world‚Äôs third-largest economy and a critical market for global investors.The successful candidate will cover Japan‚Äôs huge ‚Äì and hugely important ‚Äì stock, currency and bond markets, and work as part of an Asia-wide finance and markets breaking news team responsible for covering moves and flows of regional markets, as well as the people shaping them.This is a fast-paced job that requires quick and creative thinking, excellent news judgement and a keen eye for a great story. We are looking for someone who will be able to go beyond the daily ups-and-downs to zoom in on what is being bought and sold, and why, teasing out stories about the broader implications behind big market moves.The successful candidate will be able to use data to illustrate what‚Äôs happening in the markets, and the implications for the broader economy. This is a great opportunity for an ambitious reporter to break news and tell insightful, complex stories through the people and businesses involved in and impacted by financial markets.About The Role:As our¬†Markets Correspondent you will:Help drive our coverage of markets in Japan, a key market for our financial clientsWork with colleagues across the region to tell broad, Asia-wide markets storiesServe as part of a roster of reporters covering international markets during Asian hoursEnsure we are delivering fast, comprehensive and insightful coverage that goes beyond the numbersBuild sources at banks, brokerages and asset managers to break news and keep our readers aheadWork closely with colleagues on the Japanese language serviceAbout You:To be our¬†Markets Correspondent, you will likely have:Excellent knowledge of financial markets and the drive to always learn moreStrong Japanese language skills and excellent writing in EnglishAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritise workflowExperience building sources, using data to tell stories and using social media for newsgathering and monitoringA desire to look for innovative and interesting ways to tell market stories to a broad audienceWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. title: India M&A and Deals Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for an experienced, driven and scoop-hungry journalist with a passion for breaking news and writing ahead-of-the-curve stories on India‚Äôs booming M&A and deals landscape. Based in Mumbai, Delhi or Bangalore, the reporter in this role will focus on cultivating sources with bankers, regulators, lawyers and company voices to break news on fund raises, deals and IPOs, as well as big-picture corporate stories. The position is a key role in a country where startups are clocking sky-high valuations as India is increasingly becoming a sought-after destination for foreign investors. The role will extend beyond breaking news to writing insightful, analytical and in-depth stories about trends in India‚Äôs corporate and deal-making landscape.The successful candidate will have a proven track record in building sources, getting the inside scoops and a desire to work on deeply-reported stories. They will be part of a team of top-notch journalists who write about foreign and domestic companies, financial institutions, deals and regulations in one of Asia‚Äôs fastest-growing economies.This is a terrific opportunity for a talented and ambitious journalist to make an impact on a competitive and high-profile beat with the world‚Äôs largest independent multimedia news organisation.About the RoleAs our India M&A and Deals Correspondent, you will:-- Work closely with colleagues across the company news team in India and around the world to break news about upcoming deals, big mergers, investment banking trends and wrongdoings. -- Try and differentiate reporting by spotting trends, legal developments and regulatory problems that may affect deal-making. Dig deeper into how companies maneuver around such issues.-- Be able to build a strong network of sources in India and abroad. -- Work on insightful and high-impact stories within the wider corporate finance news file.-- Be able to take a global view to provide insights on the trends shaping financial services businesses in countries such as India and China. Closely track how big foreign investors¬† are eyeing the Indian market and companies.-- Be able to work with multimedia teams including pictures, graphics and video to develop 360-degree storytelling.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of India M&A and Deals Correspondent if you have:-- Excellent source-building and writing skills, and a passion to own and lead big news developments.-- Deep understanding of the business of financial services and companies, and the ability to explain it to a global audience.-- A strong work ethic, and are a team player willing to collaborate with tips and ideas.-- Fluency in English.What‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:-- Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities.-- Learning and Development: We have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists.-- Benefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.-- Perks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team that provides unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About Reuters Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organisations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Senior Event Coordinator - Thomson Reuters Foundation
description: Senior Event Coordinator ‚Äì Thomson Reuters Foundation¬†This full-time position will be based from our office in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.Are you highly organised? Looking for a role that grants responsibility from day one? If so, this may be the role for you. We're looking for a Senior Event Coordinator to join the Thomson Reuters Foundation's small but dynamic operations team and assist with the running of a series of exciting events. You'll be working across a unique organisation that combines the power of journalism and the law to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights.¬†As a Senior Event Coordinator, you'll lead the planning and delivery of the organisation‚Äôs key events throughout the year, such as the Trust Conference and the TrustLaw Awards (as well as other key events throughout the year). Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, this is a great opportunity to land a hands-on role in a fast-growing corporate Foundation working on some of the world‚Äôs most pressing issues.The RoleAs a Senior Event Coordinator at the Thomson Reuters Foundation, you will: Source venues and work closely with new and existing suppliers to run our events from conception to delivery (this could include organising catering, AV equipment and any other event collateral as required).Work with our Finance team to create and maintain events budgets (up to ¬£200,000), ensuring that events are delivered within budget and that invoices are submitted efficiently.Communicate with speakers, tracking their logistical requirements, booking flights and accommodation and working with internal and external stakeholders as needed.Work with our Head of Communications to develop and deliver our event marketing strategies and creative content. This includes updating our website, managing our ticketing strategy and working with our Legal team to ensure our contracts are compliant and effective.Ensure our events run smoothly on the day. This includes managing volunteers, project managing our workflows and working closely with our CEO to establish the best and most effective Trust Conference content and speaker acquisition.‚ÄãTo be our next Senior Event Coordinator, you will likely have:¬†Demonstrable experience in coordinating in-person and/or virtual events.Excellent organisational skills with the ability to prioritise effectively, work efficiently and juggle competing priorities; strong project management skills are desirable.Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You'll also be comfortable liaising with a range of senior stakeholders both inside and outside the Thomson Reuters Foundation.An understanding of budget management and the importance of accurately reporting on expenditure. The ability to solve problems, work collaboratively with others and ensure deadlines are hit.‚ÄãExperience in website management would be advantageous, as would experience with Cvent, Salesforce, Eventbrite & Zoom (advantageous). If you don't have experience with all of the above, we're still keen to hear from you!¬†Please note: the deadline for applications is 23:50 (GMT) on Sunday 8th January 2023. Early applications are encouraged.‚ÄØ¬†What‚Äôs in it For You?At the Thomson Reuters Foundation, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:¬†Global Perspective and Impact: Interested in working for a dynamic global organisation with a focus on social impact? With hubs all over the world from Bangkok to Madrid to Rio de Janeiro, join a truly international team with a shared goal of helping to build societies around the world that are free, fair and informed.¬†A Unique Approach: Our expertise in media and the law is world class; we combine the power of both to address the critical issues faced by humanity.¬†Our Relevance: With a focus on advancing media freedom, fostering more inclusive economies and promoting human rights, our work has never been more needed than right now.¬†Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.¬†Learning & Development: We are dedicated to the continual professional development of our employees and offer access to both in-house and external training opportunities.¬†About the Thomson Reuters FoundationThe‚ÄØThomson Reuters Foundation is corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. As an independent charity, registered in the UK and the USA, we work to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique media and legal services to drive systemic change.¬†#LI-JB2Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Sustainable Business Officer - Thomson Reuters Foundation
description: Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer- Thomson Reuters FoundationThis 2-year FTC will be based at our office in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.About the Thomson Reuters FoundationAre you passionate about sustainable business? Interested in the ways in which technology can change society? Are you keen to make a difference to societies on a global scale? If so, this may be the role for you.The Thomson Reuters Foundation is the corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. We believe that societies around the world should be free, fair, and informed. We work to advance media freedom, raise awareness of human rights issues, and foster more inclusive economies. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique services to drive systemic change.We're seeking a Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer to sit within our Inclusive Economies team, a dynamic and growing team within the Thomson Reuters Foundation. This team forms the hub of expertise on responsible and sustainable business practices as well as the impact of technology on society for the Foundation. We seek to foster responsible and sustainable business practices, raise awareness of the impact of technology on society, data privacy and data-led discrimination.‚ÄãAbout the Role As Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer at the Thomson Reuters Foundation, you will:Work closely with the Foundation‚Äôs project managers to deliver and manage the ‚Äòresponsible and sustainable business model‚Äô pillar. title: Business Development Manager, Global Trade Solutions
description: Are you keen to resolve global supply chain disruptions through software digitization?We are looking for a Business Development Manager to develop new businesses for our ONESOURCE Global Trade Solutions business segment. title: Emerging Markets Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for an¬†experienced, sharp and motivated journalist to join our London-based¬†emerging¬†markets¬†team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a group covering the financial markets of emerging economies worldwide, from Moscow to Brasilia and Beijing to Johannesburg, as developing nations grapple with unprecedented challenges.We want someone who can break news and deliver real insight for our readers on major developments in¬†emerging¬†markets¬†from bond defaults to capital controls and explain how global investors are approaching these economies, with the impact of climate change at the forefront of their struggles. ¬†The successful candidate will be someone who has, or can build, an extensive source network among the specialist banking, investment and legal community¬†in London and other financial centres, as well as working closely with Reuters large bureau network. The role requires a high level of numeracy and analytical ability, making the most of Thomson Reuters‚Äô extensive suite of tools. The ideal candidate will be able to join the dots on the interaction of¬†markets with the economy and policymaking, to produce insightful step-back pieces as well as breaking news, using charts and graphics to illustrate their pieces for a broad readership.¬†About the RoleAs our¬†Emerging¬†Markets Correspondent,¬†you will:¬†Deliver breaking news at speed and provide unparalleled insights on often opaque¬†marketsWork with close colleagues and teams around the world on the financial market and economic impacts of major events and policy makingInvestigate and write in-depth about investment trends and flows across all asset classes¬†Cover visiting newsmakers and government officials from around the globeInterview policy makers and influential investment professionals, often working together with our Reuters Events teamAbout YouTo be our¬†Emerging¬†Markets Correspondent, you are likely to have:Excellent knowledge of financial¬†markets¬†and investment trends, ideally across bonds, currencies and equitiesA track record of breaking news by making contacts and building sources across the investment spectrumBroad grasp of international investment and politicsWell-honed interview skills and writing experienceExcellent news judgment and ability to file from the fieldA second language, especially one used in one of the major developing¬†markets, would be an advantageWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Digital Video Curation Associate Producer
description: Reuters is looking for curators to organize and optimize the video content on our digital sites and external streaming services. This might mean curating single news assets but also grouping others intelligently and thematically.To succeed in this role, you should be an avid consumer of global news stories and of digital video storytelling. You will be working alongside a global team of video producers, and the wider digital team in Bangalore.We need people who are genuinely enthusiastic about showcasing Reuters videos through careful curation and content management. Additionally, there will be opportunities to develop your own editing and production skills.This role includes some overnight and weekend working. title: Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
description: Do you have five years + recruitment experience for Japan, either in house or agency, with a strong focus on B2B recruitment in the technology or media domains? Are you keen to ensure a great candidate and stakeholder experience and deliver the best talent in the market? ¬†Thomson Reuters Talent Acquisition APAC team is seeking a Senior TAP Contractor for 12 months to be based in Tokyo. title: Chief Correspondent, China Political & General News
description: Reuters is looking for an outstanding journalist with a track record of delivering agenda-setting coverage to lead our political and general news team in China, one of the most exciting and challenging jobs in journalism.The Chief China P&G Correspondent will be based in Beijing and drive Reuters coverage of Chinese politics, diplomacy, and society. The successful candidate will lead a team of highly-motivated journalists to deliver outstanding coverage of China and its place in the world, one of the most important stories of our time.The successful candidate will also be a proven team player, with exceptional knowledge of China and its politics and economy, and outstanding source-building and story-telling skills.About the role:As Chief China P&G Correspondent, you will:-Lead coverage that breaks exclusive news and offers deep insight-Manage and motivate a diverse and high-performing team under often-challenging circumstances-Work closely with journalists from across the Greater China team and globally-Set and communicate coverage prioritiesAbout You:To be Chief China P&G Correspondent, you will likely have:-A track record of developing, reporting and writing outstanding, ambitious stories-Have experience leading high-performing reporting teams-Outstanding news judgement and an understanding of Reuters client needs-Knowledge of visual storytelling-Proven ability to collaborate effectively across teams-Chinese language (a plus)What‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Data Scientist
description: *The physical employment location will be in McLean, VA for this role*Are you passionate about the chance to bring your data quality improvement experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?¬† Do you have the skills necessary to manage, understand, and analyze in-house and customer data including text mining, developing predictive systems, risk scoring, creating efficient algorithms, data quality improvement and other related activities? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!What You‚Äôll Do: As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving, identify, evaluate, design and implement statistical analyses of gathered open source, proprietary, and customer data to create analytic metrics and tools to support TRSS analysts, customers and existing product offerings. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute directly to the features and capabilities deployed in our applications.¬†They will work with customers to assist in gathering requirements and contributing to Statements of Work (SOWs) for new sales or POCs, and executing design post sale while getting deeply involved into the delivery of the proposed solutions. The role will interface with the customer and provide continuity of technical and data-exploration expertise to ensure we are delivering a workable solution that meets the customer requirements and technical capabilities. The position requires a proactive, mission-oriented person who strives to produce the best possible work for the customer.As the Data Scientist, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:Working with interdisciplinary engineering and research teams on designing, building and deploying data analysis systems for large data sets.¬†Working closely with customers to apply data science to their mission specific content.Creating algorithms to extract information from large data sets.¬†Establishment of scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model title: Pharmaceuticals Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for an ambitious Pharmaceuticals Correspondent to help anchor our coverage across Asia and produce agenda-setting stories.¬†The successful candidate will report on the fast-growing pharmaceutical industry across Asia, one that is becoming ever more crucial to the global supply chain for prescription medicines. China is the world‚Äôs biggest supplier of pharmaceutical ingredients and aims to rival multinational drugmakers in testing and developing novel treatments. Indian companies produce nearly one-fifth of the generic drugs used globally and is home to the Serum Institute, the world‚Äôs largest vaccine maker. Japan remains a center of innovative science for the pharma industry and is beginning to push back against paying some of the highest drug prices of any country.¬†The ideal candidate would serve as a partner to pharma industry reporters in Asia and globally, helping identify, report and write stories of global importance.¬†The reporter would be deeply sourced among pharmaceutical and biotech executives, government health officials and industry investors. The preferred location for the role is Tokyo, but open to be based in other Asia locations if a successful candidate is identified there.About the RoleAs¬†our Pharmaceuticals Correspondent, you¬†will:¬†Develop a diverse range of sources that lead to scoopsBreak exclusive news that rivals must followLead and/or reinforce coverage of major news¬†Report aggressively to hold pharmaceutical companies and the government agencies and health officials accountable¬†¬†Write insightful, in-depth stories on corporate strategy and significant new trends within the industry¬†Demonstrate beat expertise and dominanceWork with a team of experienced reporters and editors writing about health and pharma from New York, Washington, Chicago, Los Angeles, London, Europe and AsiaAbout YouAs our¬†Pharmaceuticals Correspondent,¬†you will¬†likely have:Strong knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry and regulations that govern itDeep sourcing to be able to publish exclusive news that sets the agendaProven skill covering fast-breaking newsProven record of bringing story ideas to fruition¬†Ability to understand and dissect financial disclosures¬†Demonstrated ability to multitask in a fast-moving, high-pressure environmentExcellent news judgment and writing skillsAbility to work collaboratively with others across teams and geographiesAt least three years‚Äô experience reporting at a major news organizationWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. description: Do you have a proven track record as a results-driven B2B marketer, marketing software or digital technology? title: Associate Sales Executive
description: We are seeking an Associate Sales Executive to join our Global Large Law Firm customer segment to sell our Westlaw, Practical Law, and HighQ products to the legal community within North America. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Global Large Law accounts. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of West products, sales techniques appropriate for long sales cycles and the needs of the legal profession in order to bundle information solutions to meet broad firm needs.About the Role:In this opportunity as an Associate Sales Executive, you will:Drive Results: Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel; Support in developing and executing territory growth strategiesClosing: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and support other Sales Executives with setting up demosRelationship Management: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals; description: Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? We are seeking a Strategic Alliance Manager who is knowledgeable, capable and charismatic with proven experience working with the big four advisory firms and/or leading Channel and Re-Seller businesses in Japan. You will have demonstrable success in building and executing go-to-market strategies via partner models; focused on meeting corporate sales, revenue, operational and strategic goals.About the RoleAs a Strategic Alliance Manager, you will:Execute on the overall company partnership model across all the business units of the organization to leverage the channel to new markets. Leverage the central Partnerships capability and the regions business units‚Äô partnerships capability to help build on the current Partner relationships, engagement models and agreements.Develop knowledge and strategic relationships of selected partners to build the Partnerships channel of the business. Orchestrate sales, marketing, operations, learning and support to the Partners on the execution of the partner engagement model.Construction and enhancement of the partner ecosystem to leverage the cross sell, up sell, and competitor displacement opportunities. Ensure a robust governance model for these partnerships.Drive sales strategy and planning jointly with partners through strategic relationships, joint account planning and clear go to market approach. title: Lead Site Reliability Engineer
description: Job DescriptionIdeally you are an ex-application programmer who moved to SRE/DevOps out of a love for automation and to satisfy your curiosity about computer systems. You will join and lead a team of passionate technologists dedicated to core SRE principles and building an exemplary technology organization.The role of the Lead ‚Äì Site Reliability Engineer is to be hands-on and provide mentorship to other team members on core SRE principles and tools. The lead SRE will participate in end to end operational aspects of Production environment. The individual concerned will be able to work on cloud systems, networks, databases and help drive incident lifecycle management. As a member of the SRE team, you will also be working closely with the Architects, DevOps, Product and development teams to ensure we get the most out of the software on AWS platform. This role requires a highly skilled technology professional with excellent communication skills, strategic mindset, strong analytical and troubleshooting skills on AWS Cloud Platform.Other responsibilities include working with internal business partners to gather requirements, prototyping, architecting, implementing/updating solutions, building and executing test plans, performing quality reviews, managing operations, and triaging and fixing operational issues. Site Reliability Engineers must be able to adjust to constant business change; common types of changes include new requirements, evolving goals and strategies, and emerging technologies.Key ResponsibilitiesBe hands-on and provide mentorship to a growing SRE team on core SRE principles and tools.Foster a sense of automation in issue resolution; everything possible should be automated, and only when automation can‚Äôt resolve an issue should people get involved in the resolutionLead efforts for updating production with new versions/infrastructures as they are availableLead capacity planning efforts in collaboration with Architects and DevOps engineers to determine changes to infrastructure that are needed to support new load and performance characteristicsLeads engagement with software developers, DevOps and other infrastructure engineers to integrate software development and delivery from inception to full operation, ensuring robust released software and systems.Ensure highest level of uptime to meet the customer SLA by implementing system wide corrections to prevent reoccurrence of issues.Mentor other SRE team members to further develop their soft and hard skillsTriage, troubleshoot and resolve issues using golden signals and go past golden signalsGo past golden signals with additional principles such as chaos engineering to detect failure points and lead Game days for testing resiliency of team when it comes to incident response and remediations and synthetic monitoring.Lead SRE team members to create and maintain Recovery Procedures, RCA‚Äôs in collaboration with other engineering teams.Ensure Incidents assigned to the team are being managed within agreed SLAsEnsure alarms are documented in up to date Knowledge Base Articles.Ensures Production infrastructure is up to date with server/security patches and certificates.Continuous improvement of system and application monitoring and automationIdentify and automate manual workarounds and process improvementsProactive monitoring of Monitor the availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of all servicesPerform periodic on-call duty as part of the SRE teamQualifications¬†Skilled with cloud operations/administration in Amazon AWS.Tax/Accounting domain experienceBachelors or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science discipline.5+ years‚Äô experience focussed on Site Reliability Engineering or related position in AWS Cloud Platform.At least 2 AWS Certifications are must. (AWS Sysops Admin and Architects certifications preferred).Experience working with SQL, Windows Servers, Load balancers, LinuxDeep experience with AWS, Docker and Kubernetes, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CodeDeploy, DynamoDB, Lambda, SQS, Amazon FSX, Elastic Search and networking concepts are must.Program at a high level in at least one language such as: Java, C#, Javascript, Python or Ruby.Integration experience with PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Datadog, CloudWatch.Good understanding of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) philosophies, technologies, platforms and tools, SLO management, incident resolution, and automation;Ability to explain technical concepts in clear, non-technical languageWorking knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage, and networks)Knowledge of security and compliance standards such as SOC/PCI is a plusDo you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Product Manager, Video
description: Are you excited about the future of video? Does data and technology excite you? Are you passionate about content and working for an organization that supplies news to publishers across the globe? Reuters is looking for a dynamic product manager to lead our video initiatives across our direct-to-consumer business.¬†The Video Product Manager will lead video focused initiatives across all advertising-supported video for the consumer business within Reuters ‚Äì including OTT, social, and website ‚Äì working closely with Editorial, Ad Sales & Operations, Technology and the wider Product teams.¬†About the Role¬†¬†In this opportunity as Video Product Manager, you will:¬†¬†Own enterprise Video Digital Asset Management System, Video player and Internal Video CMS tools.¬†¬†Own product management for video streaming on existing and new OTT platforms and playout on reuters.com.¬†Identify and implement new features for playback and ad-tech optimization.¬†¬†Closely partner with Revenue Operations team to ensure experience is optimized for various revenue streams (direct, open auction, and DTC).¬†¬†Prioritize the implementation of new features and set specific timelines; troubleshoot video related defects.¬†¬†Conduct research to identify user needs and gaps; keep on top of industry trends, technologies, and techniques.¬†Conduct market research to identify trends to stay ahead of the curve.¬†¬†Act as the primary liaison between internal stakeholders including Sales, Analytics, Editorial, Technology and Partners.¬†¬†¬†Work with editorial, technology, legal, customer support, and other teams to ensure that our practices, templates, and procedures make us easy to do business with.¬†¬†¬†Collaborate with the design and engineering teams to reach the best possible version of a feature (or new product).¬†¬†Manage exceptions and unexpected changes to our product portfolio and operations.¬†¬†Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the overall health of products and identify new opportunities for improvements, new ways of working, and new areas of development.¬†¬†About You¬†You‚Äôre a fit for the role of Video Product Manager if your background includes:¬†¬†Working knowledge of digital video players and streaming technologies across multiple platforms (e.g., web, mobile and different connected TV devices)¬†¬†Minimum of 3 years product experience in agile software development, including integrating customer feedback into requirements, driving prioritization and execution with a focus on improving key metrics¬†¬†Ability to read and understand technical standards and specs¬†¬†Willingness to work either independently or collaboratively across multi-functional teams as the situation requires¬†¬†Translating concepts and requests between technical and non-technical audiences¬†¬†¬†Strong track record partnering with design teams and guiding UX¬†¬†Excellent written and verbal communication skills¬†¬†Understanding of project asset management¬†¬†Understanding of digital ad insertion and ad measurement (e.g. ad beacons, IAB Open Measurement, ComScore VCE or Nielsen DAR)¬†¬†Experience working with global teams¬†¬†¬†Please be title: Tax Product Manager (UK based role)
description: Thomson Reuters is a leading provider of compliance software to the tax and accounting profession in the UK, with solutions covering personal tax, corporate tax, accounting, practice management and client collaboration.Our integrated software designed for accountants helps them save time, improve profit margins, and enhance the services they provide. Knowing they have a reliable and trusted platform underpinning their business frees them up to focus on the enhanced services they offer to their clients, providing them with a competitive edge.We have an exciting opportunity for an innovative and collaborative Tax Product Management professional to lead our UK Tax products for Tax and Accounting UK Professionals.We are seeking a self-starter with a passion for building strong products, tackling complex problems, and partnering with a diverse set of Professional Accounting firm customers, both large and small, as well as internal designers, engineers, colleagues and stakeholders.¬†As a key part of the UK Product Management leadership team, the Tax Product Manager, is responsible for the growth and development of the Tax Products in the UK suite. They lead a small tax team, instilling in them the core tenants of Product Management at Thomson Reuters while delivering against their own objectives.¬† This person will work closely with design and engineering to solve customer problems throughout the end-to-end product life cycle. This role will be responsible both for developing a strategy to grow existing Tax products, and for leading new product development efforts. This person will provide strong leadership to their team, helping to mitigate and resolve setbacks and roadblocks, build and engage a high performing product team, and foster a culture of feedback, experimentation and learning.Please note, this is a 12-month fixed term contract and will be in our UK office (hybrid mode or remote).About the RoleAs the¬†Tax Product Manager you will: Develop strong product intuition by interpreting and assessing customer problems, business needs and opportunities and offering potential solutions with a moderate level of guidance and direction.Build world class capabilities and products by assisting in the creation a vision for the Tax products and maintaining the tax products roadmap and partnering closely with dev teams and UX to execute the roadmap and deliver efficiently. This includes serving as the customer voice for the engineering teams, prioritizing the product backlog based on customer and business value, and using metrics to monitor and measure progress.Demonstrate leadership by taking extreme ownership for a product / product line, its performance and reliability, and delighting our clients with a positive experience. You will show that you can learn from your experiences, recover from setbacks, and effectively evangelize the product vision to colleagues.Build, manage and lead a world class team of product managers.¬† You will lead a team to define and deliver significant strategic initiatives.In order to be successful in achieving these goals, you will be:Curious & Innovative, starting with an obsession for our customers‚Äô problems and needs and then working closely with customers, partners, and other Thomson Reuters colleagues to solve them in unique ways.Agile, with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, unafraid of failure.An effective communicator who projects confidence and communicates concisely and clearly to management, peers, customers and partners.About You:You‚Äôre a fit for the role of Tax Product Manager if your background includes:Proven Product Management ProfessionalExperience coaching and leading a team is preferredExperience working with technology development in the tax and/or accounting arena preferredUniversity Degree in Business or Computer Science preferred (or equivalent experience)1-2 years of Product Management background¬†What‚Äôs in it for you?¬† At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Data Visualization Developer
description: Reuters is looking for an innovative and energetic data visualization developer to help transform our news file in Asia. Work with the social and online teams to develop an approach to promote each story.¬†Fact check and correct captions and identify any potential legal or ethical risksLayout and build multimedia stories using the Wider Image CMSTrack story usage data across client publications and our own platforms to inform coverage decisionsHelp curate multiple yearend Pictures of the Year packagesProvide edits of our best pictures for photo festivals as neededProduce at short notice a timely picture and text story based on viral or especially impactful imagePromote diversity of our photographer pool by helping identify and mentor new talent of diverse profiles and originsHelp keep photographers safe in the fieldAbility to work under time pressure, on tight deadlinesWillingness to work flexible hours, including some evenings and weekendsTo be our Editor, Wider Image at Reuters, you will likely have:Previous experience in visual journalismFluent English skills (speaking and writing). title: Australia Agriculture Correspondent, Canberra
description: Reuters is looking for a proactive and ambitious reporter to cover Australia‚Äôs agricultural sector and deliver an initiative-led file spanning diplomacy, international trade, climate change and the future-proofing of industrial farming in the 21st century.¬†¬†Australia is a major exporter of beef, wheat, barley, sugar, cotton, sorghum, oats, almonds and other commodities, and it has a substantial freight advantage over suppliers in the Americas and Western Europe in serving the world‚Äôs largest and fastest growing markets in Asia. But with the country embroiled in a trade spat with China, a major and inefficient rerouting of several commodity supply lines is underway as exporters scramble to replace that single mammoth buyer with dozens of smaller and farther-flung alternatives.¬†¬†The Australia Agriculture Correspondent‚Äôs reporting will also show the impact of climate change on the agricultural sector. Within the past decade, the country has suffered major droughts, horrendous bushfires and widespread flooding that have curbed or damaged large-scale rural investments and undermined lender confidence in the long-term viability of the Australian farm sector.¬†Based in our office in Parliament House in Canberra, the successful candidate will also be the face of Reuters for politicians, industry bodies and government departments in the capital, will cover major government announcements on a range of issues, and will work with a team of specialist beat reporters across the Australian bureau.¬†¬†About the RoleAs our Australia Agriculture Correspondent, you will:Have a knack for reporting and writing high-impact storiesBuild sources across government, industry, and market participantsBe able to Identify and develop exclusive news stories that will distinguish Reuters from other mediaCollaborate closely with reporters in Australia and in other regionsWork with multimedia teams including pictures, graphics and video¬†¬†To be our Australia Agriculture Correspondent, you will likely have:Experience covering commodity/financial marketsStrong news judgement¬†Ability to filter quickly through complex information to identify and explain key news elements¬†Skill with social media news gathering and monitoring¬†Experience working in real-time news bureauWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalistsBenefits:¬†We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering daysPerks:¬†Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important stories.About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. title: Strategic Partnerships Manager - ANZ
description: Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? We are seeking a Strategic Partnerships Manager who is knowledgeable, capable and charismatic with proven experience working with the big four advisory firms and/or leading Channel and Re-Seller businesses in ANZ. You will have demonstrable success in building and executing go-to-market strategies via partner models; focused on meeting corporate sales, revenue, operational and strategic goals.About the RoleIn this role of Strategic Partnerships Manager ANZ, you will have the following responsibilities/accountabilities:Execute on the overall company partnership model across all the business units of the organization to leverage the channel to new markets. Leverage the central Partnerships capability and the regions business units‚Äô partnerships capability to help build on the current Partner relationships, engagement models and agreements.Develop knowledge and strategic relationships of selected partners to build the Partnerships channel of the business. Orchestrate sales, marketing, operations, learning and support to the Partners on the execution of the partner engagement model.Construction and enhancement of the partner ecosystem to leverage the cross sell, up sell, and competitor displacement opportunities. Business development skills, commercial acumen and market knowledge will be required.Build engines and connections on channel development, partner sales plan and partner ecosystem construction through the proper number of partners & channels, including sales, marketing, training, support.Partner with assigned enterprises to identify and deliver on potential new opportunities such as new market development, co-creation or new products and services. Ensure a robust governance model for these partnerships.Drive sales strategy and planning jointly with partners through strategic relationships, joint account planning and clear go to market approach. Increase partner reach, frequency and yield, as KPIs to achieve revenue and market share goals.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for this role if you possess the following qualifications and experiences:Degree or Master‚Äôs in Business Administration with at least 10 years of business development and or sales/partnership experience with large enterprise technology companies in ANZ.Strong executor of strategies within the A market to establish effective alliance with identified partners. description: Are you excited about the future of video? Does data and technology excite you? title: Commodities Correspondent, Indonesia
description: Reuters is looking for a dynamic and experienced correspondent to cover commodities and energy in resource-rich Indonesia, Southeast Asia‚Äôs largest economy that is also the world's top producer of palm oil and a major global supplier of coal, tin, copper, nickel, rubber, coffee, oil and gas as well as a big global buyer of wheat.The right candidate must be able to break news and deliver insightful, agenda-setting stories on these commodities and energy markets, the frequently changing government policy, as well as the economic and environmental impact of resource extraction. The role will require explaining complex topics to readers around the world.The successful candidate will be a team player who will work with our financial team and is expected to help coverage in other industries such as aviation, batteries and automotive. As part of the Reuters Indonesia bureau, the successful candidate may also need to cover news stories on other subjects at times.High proficiency in Indonesian and English languages is required. Experience as a journalist in Indonesia, with a network of sources, is desired.About the RoleAs our Indonesia Commodities Correspondent, you will:Cover fast-paced, breaking news while delivering deeper, exclusive storiesWrite fast and file accurate stories under time pressureDevelop sources among policymakers, regulators, traders, companies and other stakeholdersGenerate story ideas, deliver scoops and stories that show a smart, creative approachReport on other subjects as needed for our overall Indonesia coverageAbout YouTo be our Indonesia Commodities Correspondent, you will likely have:Excellent news judgment and strong reporting skillsGood understanding of and strong interest in commodity and energy markets and their regulatory environmentAbility to think outside the box and produce deeply reported, impactful enterprise journalism that illuminates complex topicsMinimum of three years of journalism experienceProven track record as team playerExcellent English writing skills and preferably fluent in conversational Bahasa IndonesiaPassion to learn new skills and adapt to new tools and technologyWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Sr site reliability engineer
description: Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world‚Äôs largest international multimedia news provider reaching more than one billion people every day. You will work closely with the other members of the TRSS analytical staff and development to capture customer requirements and design new solutions. This role requires a polyglot engineer who is comfortable with data-intensive systems as well as some frontend UI development. You will be working with an extensive codebase, but this role is a great opportunity to engage in new development.¬†As the Senior Software Engineer, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:You will be expected to turn ideas in technical solutions with minimal directionYou may be asked to lead projects or efforts and will act as a mentor to less experienced developersYou will be part of the specialized TRSS development team and will design implement and deliver software solutions and data science efforts, as well as enhance and support existing applicationsYou will engage the TRSS analytical staff to gather requirements, generate ideas, and develop documentationYou will demo new software solutions as neededYou will learn and expand your skill set on the jobYou will be expected to own your work and be passionate about the success of the customerAbout You:You‚Äôre a good fit for the role of Senior Software Engineer if you have:B.S. in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent work experience¬†At least 3 years of professional software development experienceBe of strong moral and ethical character and have a strong personal work ethicExperience mentoring less experienced developers and/or leading small projects or teamsStrong Engineering and Problem-Solving skillsMust be a passionate, smart, and articulate technologistFull Stack Development experience with the following stack or similar:Backend: Java SpringBoot (Preferred), or PythonFrontend: React (Preferred), Angular, or VueDatabase: MongoDB, MySQLDevops: Docker containerization, Jenkins, git, mavenAbility to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearanceThe following skills and tools are preferred, but not required:AWS experience strongly desiredNeo4J or other graph technologyKafkaGrails, GroovyElasticSearchWhat‚Äôs in it For You?At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. title: Service Delivery Lead - SAP
description: C2C ‚ÄìService Delivery LeadACCOUNTABILITIES The Service Lead (SL) role is responsible for defining and prioritizing Defect and Service improvement initiatives with our Technology partners and for driving Root Cause Analysis completion.The SL is responsible for ensuring consistent TR wide adherence to Problem Management processes and for working with our Technology Demand Lead to ensure that fixes are prioritized alongside New Demand.The SL role is responsible for representing TR during all Major Outages to ensure that preventative measures are pursued through to closure to ensure risk of recurrence is minimized.The SL role will also take a lead in defining Service Models for new strategic offerings pursued by the business, and for defining and owning our TCS incident Escalation processes.Should be a hands on expert on SAP ABAP and SD areasVision & Strategy ‚Ä¢ Act as the Champion for best-in-class Service and challenge partners to deliver reliable and user-friendly solutions.Uses his techno functional expertise in SAP to deep dive , understand and provide inputs to fix SAP issues technically and propose improvements.‚Ä¢ Partners with Technology owners to identify solutions to existing Service risks which can be delivered within budget.‚Ä¢ Collaborates with the wider Business Units to ensure our priorities are aligned with addressing Priority pain points.
