title: Senior Desk Editor, Bangalore Desk
description: Senior Desk Editor, Bangalore Desk The Reuters Bangalore bureau, the largest Reuters news operation in the world, has set a global benchmark for producing real-time company and markets news at speed. The Bangalore Desk is an integral part of this operation, editing every story produced in the bureau and providing hands-on editorial guidance to hundreds of reporters who are covering companies from Sydney to San Francisco. The team of editors, which works 24x5, is also integrated with the Global News Desk, editing stories from other locations as well.Reuters News is looking for a Senior Desk Editor to help run the fast-paced editing desk in the Bangalore bureau.About You:The ideal candidate will:Have a strong background in news editing, with an eye for detail and the ability to simplify and explain often-complex material. They will be well versed in financial news and comfortable editing stories across financial markets and company news;Adept at making split-second editing decisions on fast-moving news, while also masterfully crafting longer stories that appeal both to professionals who rely on Reuters News to help make investment decisions and general readers who access news through Reuters.com and media outlets worldwide;Be skilled at giving constructive and real-time feedback as they safeguard Reuters‚Äô high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies.And as a Senior Desk Editor, you will:Edit, rewrite and reshape stories with dynamic prose and strong news judgment; ensure stories have context and actionable content for clients; produce sharp headlines, punchy leads and overall lively writingRun shiftsEnsure that stories meet Reuters‚Äô standards for accuracy, speed, balance and clarity.Enforce Reuters‚Äô high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies laid out by the Reuters Trust Principles and the Reuters Handbook for JournalistsExperience & Behaviours:To apply for this role, you will likely have:5-10 years of experience editing business news. Reporters with proven writing and team leading skills will also be considered.An ability to multi-task and deliver under pressureStrong communication skills along with a Diverse & Inclusive mindset.What‚Äôs in it for you:At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training resources and offers exposure to leading talent programs both internally & externallyBenefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days, Flexible Work Arrangements, Work-From-Anywhere option, comprehensive health cover self & family, savings & investment plansPerks: Work alongside diverse global professionals to gain true global experience, social events & activities.About Reuters Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. The team of editors, which works 24x5, is also integrated with the Global News Desk, editing stories from other locations as well.We are looking for a Desk Editor to help run the fast-paced editing desk in the Bangalore bureau.About You:The ideal candidate will be:Adept at performing quickly under pressure as they work with reporters and news editors to produce compelling stories that appeal both to professional clients who rely on Reuters to help make investment decisions and general readers who access Reuters news through Reuters.com and media outlets worldwide.Well be versed in financial news and comfortable editing stories across asset classes;An individual who has a strong background in editing, with an eye for detail and the ability to simplify and explain often-complex material.And as a Desk Editor, you will:Edit, rewrite and reshape stories with dynamic prose and strong news judgment; ensure stories have context and actionable content for clients; produce sharp headlines, punchy leads and overall lively writingEnsure that stories meet Reuters‚Äô standards for accuracy, speed, balance and clarity.Enforce Reuters‚Äô high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies laid out by the Reuters Trust Principles and the Reuters Handbook of JournalistsExperience & Behaviours:To apply for this role, you will likely have:At least 5 years of experience editing business news. Reporters with proven writing skills will also be consideredAn ability to multi-task and deliver under pressureStrong communication skills along with a Diverse & Inclusive mindsetWhat‚Äôs in it for you:At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have dedicated training resources and offer exposure to leading talent programs both internally & externallyBenefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days, Flexible Work Arrangements, Work-From-Anywhere option, comprehensive health cover for self & family, savings & investment plansPerks: Work alongside diverse global professionals to gain true global experience, social events & activities.About Reuters Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. title: Manager, Product Management
description: Thomson Reuters is a leading provider of compliance software to the tax and accounting profession in the UK, with solutions covering personal tax, corporate tax, accounting, practice management and client collaboration.Our integrated software designed for accountants helps them save time, improve profit margins, and enhance the services they provide. Knowing they have a reliable and trusted platform underpinning their business frees them up to focus on the enhanced services they offer to their clients, providing them with a competitive edge.We have an exciting opportunity for an innovative and collaborative Product Management professional to lead our UK suite of products for Tax and Accounting Professionals.We are seeking a self-starter with a passion for building strong product teams, tackling complex problems, and partnering with a diverse set of global customers, designers, engineers, colleagues and stakeholders.¬†As part of the Product Management people leadership team, the Manager, Product Management is responsible for the growth and development of the Product Managers they lead, instilling in them the core tenants of Product Management at Thomson Reuters while delivering against their own objectives.¬† This person will work closely with design and engineering to solve customer problems throughout the end-to-end product life cycle. This role will be responsible both for developing a strategy to grow existing products, and for leading new product development efforts. This person will provide strong leadership to their team, helping to mitigate and resolve setbacks and roadblocks, build and engage a high performing product team, and foster a culture of feedback, experimentation and learning.About the RoleAs a¬†Manager, Product Management you will: Develop strong product intuition by interpreting and assessing customer problems, business needs and opportunities and offering potential solutions with a moderate level of guidance and direction.Build world class capabilities and products by creating a vision for product and maintaining the product roadmap and partnering closely with dev teams and UX to execute the roadmap and deliver efficiently. This includes serving as the customer voice for the engineering teams, prioritizing the product backlog based on customer and business value, and using metrics to monitor and measure progress.Demonstrate leadership by taking extreme ownership for a product / product line, its performance and reliability, and delighting our clients with a positive experience. You will show that you can learn from your experiences, recover from setbacks, and effectively evangelize the product vision to colleagues.Build, manage and lead a world class team of product managers.¬† You will lead a team to define and deliver significant strategic initiatives.In order to be successful in achieving these goals, you will be:Curious & Innovative, starting with an obsession for our customers‚Äô problems and needs and then working closely with customers, partners, and other Thomson Reuters colleagues to solve them in unique waysAgile with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, unafraid of failureAn effective communicator who projects confidence and communicates concisely and clearly to management, peers, customers and partnersAbout YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of Manager, Product Management if your background includes:Proven Product Management Professional¬†Experience coaching and leading a team is preferredExperience working with technology development in the tax and/or accounting arena preferredUniversity Degree in Business or Computer Science preferred (or equivalent experience)5-7 years of Product Management background¬†What‚Äôs in it for you?¬† At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Associate Sales Executive
description: Team MissionOur team is responsible for helping both new and existing customers make informed business decisions to better manage the ever-changing business ecosystem through our highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for Tax & Accounting professionals. Our software products drive productivity, data, content and research capabilities through world-class AI and machine learning. We measure our success by achieving new sales and retention targets as well as achieving high customer and employee satisfaction scores.We enable success through intensive training and onboarding that allows you to become a product expert, and continued mentorship programs to help you hit those sales goals every month. If you want to be a part of a high performing sales organization and have an immediate impact, apply today!About the RoleThe Associate Sales Executive in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Small-Mid client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 1-30 professionals. The Associate Sales Executive position is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.The successful Associate Sales Executive:Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters‚Äô products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.Note: This is an inside sales *hybrid role (*mix of working 2 days 'in-office' and 3 days from home/remote each week) that can be based in any of these corporate Hub office locations: Ann Arbor, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Dallas/Carrollton.What You Will Do:In this opportunity as an Associate Sales Executive, you will:Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basisDemonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customerObtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetrationConfer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relationsComplete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate mannerDrives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territoryLeverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)Attend sales meetings and title: China Agriculture Correspondent
description: Reuters is looking for a dynamic journalist with great ideas and experience reporting on commodities to cover China‚Äôs vast agriculture sector, based in Beijing. The ¬†successful candidate will break news and report and write insightful and high-value initiative stories on the trade and production of foodstuffs that feed China‚Äôs 1.4 billion people, covering everything from grain harvests and food security to hog prices, animal health and international trade (including trade disputes).The China Agriculture Correspondent will have a penchant for source-building and a knack for reporting and writing high-impact stories, from scoops to features, on the world‚Äôs biggest consumer of most key agricultural commodities. This is a great opportunity for a journalist eager to build deep expertise and report from the field - literally - to deliver outstanding stories for a global audience of both specialist and general readers.As China Agriculture Correspondent, you will:Build sources in trading firms to break news on purchases of farm commoditiesReport on often opaque government policies and their impact on global agricultural marketsCover trade in agricultural futures and physical marketsWrite fast and accurate headlines and stories under time pressureWork closely with colleagues in the China commodities and energy team and around the worldTo be China Agriculture Correspondent, you will:Have great ideas and demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding storiesHave strong news judgementHave strong Mandarin and fluent EnglishBe comfortable working with data and have an interest in marketsBe a strong communicator and team playerHave experience covering commoditiesWhat‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. title: Sr Marketing Audience Activation Specialist
description: ResponsibilitiesWork with segment stakeholders to gather goals, success metrics, and size/prioritize segment creation to meet campaign KPIsCollaborate with marketing and customer data teams to build a cohesive and unified view of audience data, facilitating new integrations within and outside of the platform to enhance audience capabilities and design audiences that map to business goals.Continuously analyze digital channel data as well as internal, external, and integrated audience data to generate audience-specific insights that drive business decisions and initiatives, from planning phases through activation, and identify optimization opportunities against Demand Gen and eCommerce goals.Develop advanced customer segmentation strategies and use segmentation to build audiences in partnership with the Optimization team; target and find those customers (and similar customers) across marketing channels and build a process to ensure audience quality maintenance.Effectively develop new and efficient data strategies to keep up with the ever-changing landscape of data. title: U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter
description: Job Description: ¬†¬†Reuters is looking for an outstanding reporter and writer for a high-profile position covering liquefied natural gas (LNG), the industry that feeds into gas exports and the broader energy transition to cleaner and renewable fuels, based in Houston. This is an exciting opportunity to cover a fast-growing market for a fuel many governments view as a transition fuel. Global gas supplies are high on the news agenda as the war in Ukraine disrupts energy trade lines and puts energy security top of the agenda in Europe and much of Asia. Investor and public pressures for a rapid transition from fossil fuels to clean energies are upending the energy business and may curtail LNG‚Äôs growth. The successful candidate will be able to write on deadline and use video and other media to capture the enormous financial, political and technological upheaval as lower-carbon fuels become a larger force in markets.About the Role:As our U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter, you will:¬†Report on LNG markets, suppliers, customers and pricing, and contribute to and write regular reports on LNG markets.Report on natural gas production, demand and flows, and the pipeline business.Produce scoops and set the agenda on coverage as U.S. LNG exporters challenge global rivals.Generate and execute ambitious and enterprising stories on the gas and LNG industry.Report on the utility sector, growing renewable power supplies, carbon credits and their interplay with gas and LNG.Bring ideas and drive to reporting and writing about the intricacies of global energy flows.Collaborate with journalists in Asia, Europe, and the United States to break exclusive news.Work with other journalists in Houston and beyond on regional and national coverage across the file. This can include election, storm, sports and other general news, as necessary.About YouYou‚Äôre a fit for the role of¬†U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter if you have:At least five years‚Äô experience covering finance or commodities, preferably in energy.A track record in breaking news.A clip file that shows extensive in-depth reporting and your ability to tackle ambitious and high impact stories.Strong news judgment and the ability to deliver stories in a fast-paced newsroom.Outstanding source building skills.Multimedia skills.Excellent team skills.What‚Äôs in it For YouAt Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:Global Career:¬†As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunitiesLearning & Development: we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employeesBenefits:¬†we offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefitsPerks:¬† Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world‚Äôs most important storiesAbout Reuters Reuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.Reuters: The Real World in Real time#LI-CH1Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Video Journalist
description: Reuters is looking for an energetic Video Journalist with strong news judgement to join our Visuals team in Beijing. The successful candidate will be part of a high-performing team, where Reuters video content is published directly to subscribers.The successful candidate should have strong English language and writing abilities, able to speak, read and write business Mandarin to a level where he or she can work independently in the field and communicate with Chinese clients and sources. title: Data Scientist
description: *The physical employment location will be in McLean, VA for this role*Are you passionate about the chance to bring your data quality improvement experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?¬† Do you have the skills necessary to manage, understand, and analyze in-house and customer data including text mining, developing predictive systems, risk scoring, creating efficient algorithms, data quality improvement and other related activities? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!What You‚Äôll Do: As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving, identify, evaluate, design and implement statistical analyses of gathered open source, proprietary, and customer data to create analytic metrics and tools to support TRSS analysts, customers and existing product offerings. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute directly to the features and capabilities deployed in our applications.¬†They will work with customers to assist in gathering requirements and contributing to Statements of Work (SOWs) for new sales or POCs, and executing design post sale while getting deeply involved into the delivery of the proposed solutions. The role will interface with the customer and provide continuity of technical and data-exploration expertise to ensure we are delivering a workable solution that meets the customer requirements and technical capabilities. The position requires a proactive, mission-oriented person who strives to produce the best possible work for the customer.As the Data Scientist, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:Working with interdisciplinary engineering and research teams on designing, building and deploying data analysis systems for large data sets.¬†Working closely with customers to apply data science to their mission specific content.Creating algorithms to extract information from large data sets.¬†Establishment of scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model validation, model implementation, and large-scale data analysis.¬†Development of metrics and prototypes that can be used to drive business decisions.¬†Providing thought-leadership and dependable execution on diverse projects.¬†Identification of emergent trends and opportunities for future client growth and development.Researching and identifying Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods ‚Äì including Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods.Identification of new applications of AI in the context of Thomson Reuters and TRSS content sets.Exploring existing data for insights, and recommends additional sources of data for improvement.About You:You‚Äôre a good fit for the role of Data Scientist if you have:A minimum of DHS-granted public trust suitability required, active DOD Secret or Top-Secret clearance preferred.¬†¬†A Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, computer science, mathematics, physical/biological sciences, or GIS). 10 years of experience with data cleaning, analysis, programming, and reporting of results to internal or external stakeholders (education can substitute for some years of experience)Programming skills in one or more major programming languages¬†(Python/R/Java).Are creative, intellectually curious, and willing to experiment and work in dynamic organizations and situations, sometimes with little oversight or well-defined requirements.The ability to take ownership for defined areas of accountability, most critically the integrity of the technical and data design in terms of meeting customer needs, design delivery and supportability.A good understanding of distributed computing concepts.Experience facilitating and gathering input from subject matter experts.¬†Excellent understanding of ML, NLP, and statistical methodologies.‚ÄãThe ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation.Strong planning, time management, and organizational skills.A team player / self-starter mentality with the ability to work using own initiative.¬†Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance.Additional Desired Skills:Big Data analytics experience (preferred, but not required).Previous experience with data modeling for graphs (preferred, but not required).Experience with search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems, and relevance evaluation methodologies (preferred, but not required).What‚Äôs in it For You?At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people description: About ReutersReuters is the world‚Äôs largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias.
